title: African-asian spiced savory pancakes
directions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour and salt. Add eggs, coconut milk, and soy sauce to the dry ingredients and whisk until smooth. Stir in cumin, ginger, chili, spring onions, and coriander. Let the batter rest for 10 minutes. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly oil it. Pour a ladle of batter into the skillet and swirl to spread evenly. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until bubbles form and the bottom is golden. Flip and cook the other side for 1 to 2 minutes until cooked through. Repeat with remaining batter, adding oil as needed. Serve warm with a dipping sauce or yogurt.
ingredients: flour, salt, eggs, coconut milk, soy sauce, cumin, ginger, chili, spring onions, coriander, oil

title: Chef style african-asian chicken stir fry
directions: Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over medium heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and green beans, stir-fry until tender-crisp. Return chicken to the pan and mix well. Stir in soy sauce, peanut butter, ground coriander, and chili flakes. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot over cooked jasmine rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.
ingredients: oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, green beans, soy sauce, peanut butter, ground coriander, chili flakes, salt, pepper, jasmine rice, cilantro

title: African-asian fusion goulash recipe
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add beef cubes and brown on all sides. Stir in onion, garlic, and ginger and Grill until fragrant. Mix in curry powder, paprika, and tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes. Add diced tomatoes and beef broth to the pot. Stir in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes. Add chopped bell pepper and okra and cook for 10 more minutes. Check seasoning and adjust if needed. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.

title: Spiced coconut waffles with mango chutney
directions: Preheat waffle iron according to manufacturer’s instructions. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom, ginger, and salt. In another bowl, beat eggs, then mix in coconut milk, oil, and vanilla extract. Combine wet and dry ingredients, stirring until just blended. Lightly grease waffle iron and pour in batter to desired amount. Cook waffles until golden and crisp, about 4 to 5 minutes. In a small bowl, mix mango, red onion, ginger, and lime juice to make chutney. Serve warm waffles topped with fresh mango chutney.
ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom, ginger, salt, eggs, coconut milk, oil, vanilla extract, mango, red onion, lime juice

title: Spicy courgette stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat. Add tofu cubes and cook until golden on all sides, then remove and set aside. In the same pan, Grill garlic, ginger, and onion until fragrant. Add courgette and bell pepper and stir-fry for 5 to 7 minutes until tender-crisp. Return tofu to the pan and mix well. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, chili flakes, lemon juice, and water until smooth. Pour the sauce into the pan and stir to coat all ingredients evenly. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until heated through. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: oil, tofu, garlic, ginger, onion, courgette, bell pepper, soy sauce, peanut butter, chili flakes, lemon juice, water, fresh coriander

title: African-asian fusion pizza dough
directions: In a large bowl, mix flour, yeast, sugar, salt, and baobab powder. Add warm water, sesame oil, and grated ginger to the dry ingredients. Stir until a shaggy dough forms, then knead on a floured surface for 8 minutes. Shape into a ball and place in a lightly oiled bowl. Cover with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled. Punch down the dough and knead briefly to remove air bubbles. Divide dough into two portions for personal-sized pizzas. Roll out each portion to desired thickness on a floured surface. Add toppings and bake in a preheated oven at 220°C (425°F) for 12 to 15 minutes.
ingredients: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, baobab powder, warm water, sesame oil, grated ginger

title: Airfryer african-asian chicken skewers
directions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, peanut butter, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, coriander, paprika, and oil. Add chicken chunks to the marinade and toss to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Thread marinated chicken, bell pepper, and onion onto skewers. Preheat airfryer to 180°C (350°F) for 3 minutes. Place skewers in the airfryer basket in a single layer. Cook for 12 to 15 minutes, turning halfway through, until chicken is cooked through. Remove skewers and let rest for 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: soy sauce, peanut butter, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, coriander, paprika, oil, chicken, bell pepper, onion, fresh cilantro

title: Spiced cauliflower stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and Grill until soft and translucent. Stir in garlic and ginger, cooking for 1 minute. Add cauliflower florets and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle in cumin, coriander, cayenne, and a pinch of salt. Pour in soy sauce and stir to coat the vegetables. Whisk together peanut butter and coconut milk until smooth. Pour the peanut sauce into the pan and stir well. Cover and simmer for 8 to 10 minutes until cauliflower is tender. Drizzle with lemon juice and garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, cauliflower florets, cumin, coriander, cayenne, salt, soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, lemon juice, cilantro

title: African asian fusion bolognese
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and Grill until soft. Stir in the ground beef and cook until browned. Mix in tomato paste, diced tomatoes, and berbere spice. Add soy sauce, coriander, and green chilies. Pour in coconut milk and stir well. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over cooked spaghetti or rice noodles. Garnish with fresh herbs if desired.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, ground beef, tomato paste, diced tomatoes, berbere spice, soy sauce, coriander, green chilies, coconut milk, salt, pepper, spaghetti, rice noodles, fresh herbs

title: Dubai chocolate spiced date truffles
directions: Soak the pitted dates in warm water for 10 minutes and drain. Melt the dark chocolate with coconut oil over a double boiler until smooth. Add dates, peanuts, melted chocolate, cardamom, cinnamon, chili powder, and rose water to a food processor. Blend until the mixture forms a sticky dough. Scoop out small portions and roll into bite-sized balls. Roll each truffle in desiccated coconut to coat. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to one week.
ingredients: pitted dates, dark chocolate, coconut oil, peanuts, cardamom, cinnamon, chili powder, rose water, desiccated coconut

title: African-asian spiced savory pancakes
directions: In a large bowl, whisk together flour and salt. Add eggs, coconut milk, and soy sauce to the dry ingredients and whisk until smooth. Stir in cumin, ginger, chili, spring onions, and coriander. Let the batter rest for 10 minutes. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and lightly oil it. Pour a ladle of batter into the skillet and swirl to spread evenly. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until bubbles form and the bottom is golden. Flip and cook the other side for 1 to 2 minutes until cooked through. Repeat with remaining batter, adding oil as needed. Serve warm with a dipping sauce or yogurt.
ingredients: flour, salt, eggs, coconut milk, soy sauce, cumin, ginger, chili, spring onions, coriander, oil

title: Spiced banana bread with ginger and coconut
directions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and grease a loaf pan. In a large bowl, whisk mashed bananas, sugar, eggs, oil, and vanilla until smooth. In a separate bowl, mix flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, and cardamom. Add dry ingredients to banana mixture and stir until just combined. Fold in coconut and chopped peanuts gently. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan and smooth the top. Sprinkle sesame seeds evenly over the batter. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack. Slice and serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: bananas, sugar, eggs, oil, vanilla, flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cardamom, coconut, peanuts, sesame seeds

title: Spiced chickpea crepes with peanut sauce
directions: In a bowl, whisk chickpea flour, water, egg, cumin, turmeric, and salt until smooth. Stir in chopped cilantro and let batter rest for 10 minutes. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and lightly oil it. Pour a ladle of batter into the pan, swirling to coat evenly. Cook for 2 minutes until edges lift, then flip and cook another minute. Repeat with remaining batter to make 4 crepes. Mix mashed sweet potato, onion, green chili, and crushed peanuts in a bowl. In a small saucepan, warm coconut milk and peanut butter until smooth. Fill each crepe with sweet potato mixture and fold. Drizzle with warm peanut sauce before serving.
ingredients: chickpea flour, water, egg, cumin, turmeric, salt, cilantro, sweet potato, onion, green chili, crushed peanuts, coconut milk, peanut butter, peanut sauce

title: African-asian spiced apple pie twist
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a 23 cm (9-inch) pie dish. Peel, core, and slice the apples thinly. In a bowl, mix apples with sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, and lemon juice. Heat butter in a pan and Grill the apple mixture for 5 minutes until slightly softened. Roll out one pastry sheet and press into the pie dish. Fill the crust with the apple mixture and sprinkle with chopped dates. Roll out the second pastry sheet and place over the filling, sealing the edges. Cut small slits in the top crust for steam to escape. Brush the crust with beaten egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until golden brown and bubbling.
ingredients: apples, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, lemon juice, butter, pastry sheet, dates, egg, sesame seeds

title: Spicy african-asian fusion bruschetta
directions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Brush baguette slices with olive oil and toast for 8 to 10 minutes until golden. Rub toasted bread with cut side of garlic clove and set aside. In a bowl, mix cherry tomatoes, onion, coriander, basil, chili, and ginger. Add soy sauce and lime juice to the tomato mixture and stir well. Spoon the mixture evenly onto the toasted bread slices. Top each bruschetta with a sprinkle of crumbled feta cheese. Arrange on a serving platter and serve immediately.
ingredients: olive oil, baguette, garlic clove, cherry tomatoes, onion, coriander, basil, chili, ginger, soy sauce, lime juice, feta cheese

title: African-asian fusion chicken carbonara
directions: Cook spaghetti in salted boiling water until al dente, then drain and reserve 100  of pasta water. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chicken slices and cook until lightly browned and cooked through. Stir in garlic, chili, and sausage, and Grill for 2 minutes. In a bowl, whisk eggs, coconut milk, Parmesan, soy sauce, and black pepper. Reduce heat to low and add cooked spaghetti to the pan. Quickly pour in the egg mixture, stirring constantly to create a creamy sauce. Add reserved pasta water as needed to loosen the sauce. Season with salt to taste and sprinkle with chopped coriander before serving.
ingredients: spaghetti, vegetable oil, chicken, garlic, chili, sausage, eggs, coconut milk, Parmesan, soy sauce, black pepper, salt, coriander

title: Spicy african-asian fusion hummus
directions: Place chickpeas, tahini, and peanut butter in a food processor. Add sesame oil, garlic, chili, ginger, lemon juice, and soy sauce. Sprinkle in cumin, coriander, and a pinch of salt. Blend until smooth, adding water gradually to adjust consistency. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Transfer to a serving bowl and smooth the surface. Drizzle a little sesame oil on top for flavor. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve with flatbread, rice crackers, or vegetable sticks. Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.
ingredients: chickpeas, tahini, peanut butter, sesame oil, garlic, chili, ginger, lemon juice, soy sauce, cumin, coriander, salt, water, fresh coriander leaves, flatbread, rice crackers, vegetable sticks

title: African-asian fusion kaiserschmarrn
directions: Whisk egg yolks with coconut milk, both flours, sugar, cardamom, and salt until smooth. Fold in melted butter and chopped dried mango. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold egg whites into the batter until just combined. Heat butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour in batter and cook until bottom is golden and top is nearly set. Flip in sections and tear into bite-sized pieces using two spatulas. Continue cooking until all pieces are golden and cooked through. Sprinkle with roasted sesame seeds and chopped peanuts. Dust with icing sugar and serve warm with honey or tamarind syrup.
ingredients: egg yolks, coconut milk, flours, sugar, cardamom, salt, butter, dried mango, egg whites, sesame seeds, peanuts, icing sugar, honey, tamarind syrup

title: Spiced pumpkin soup with coconut and ginger
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant and softened. Add coriander and cumin, stirring for 1 minute to release aromas. Add pumpkin cubes and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes until pumpkin is tender. Stir in coconut milk and soy sauce, then simmer for 5 more minutes. Blend the soup until smooth using an immersion blender or in batches. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, coriander, cumin, pumpkin, vegetable broth, coconut milk, soy sauce, salt, pepper, cilantro

title: Spicy red cabbage stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large wok over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili and Grill until fragrant. Stir in sliced red cabbage and cook for 5 to 7 minutes until slightly softened. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, peanut butter, and water. Pour the sauce into the wok and stir well to coat the cabbage. Cook for another 3 to 5 minutes until cabbage is tender-crisp and sauce thickens. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped peanuts. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, red cabbage, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, peanut butter, water, peanuts, coriander, rice, flatbread

title: Matcha rooibos tiramisu with coconut cream
directions: Whisk mascarpone, coconut cream, condensed milk, vanilla extract, and powdered sugar until smooth. Mix cooled rooibos tea with 1 tablespoon of matcha powder until fully dissolved. Dip each ladyfinger briefly into the rooibos-matcha mixture without soaking. Arrange half the soaked ladyfingers in a single layer in a square dish. Spread half of the coconut mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers evenly. Repeat with remaining ladyfingers and spread the rest of the cream on top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight for best texture. Before serving, dust the top with remaining matcha powder and sprinkle with desiccated coconut. Slice and serve chilled.
ingredients: mascarpone, coconut cream, condensed milk, vanilla extract, powdered sugar, rooibos tea, matcha powder, ladyfinger, desiccated coconut

title: Cinnamon buns with chai and coconut glaze
directions: In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, salt, and yeast. Add warm coconut milk, melted butter, and egg to the dry ingredients and mix until a dough forms. Knead the dough on a floured surface for 8 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover and let the dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Roll the dough into a rectangle and spread softened butter over the surface. Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over the buttered dough. Roll up the dough tightly and slice into 8 equal pieces. Place slices in a greased baking dish and let rise for 30 minutes. Bake at 180°C (350°F) for 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown. Mix powdered sugar with brewed chai to make a glaze and drizzle over warm buns.
ingredients: flour, sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, salt, yeast, coconut milk, butter, egg, brown sugar, powdered sugar, chai

title: Aperol spritz with hibiscus and ginger twist
directions: Combine hibiscus petals, ginger, honey, and water in a small saucepan. Bring to a simmer and steep for 10 minutes off heat. Strain the syrup and let it cool completely. Fill four glasses with ice cubes. Pour 1 tablespoon of hibiscus-ginger syrup into each glass. Add 30  Aperol to each glass. Top with 60  prosecco and 30  soda water. Stir gently to mix. Garnish with orange slices and mint leaves. Serve immediately while chilled.
ingredients: hibiscus petals, ginger, honey, water, ice cubes, Aperol, prosecco, soda water, orange slices, mint leaves

title: Spicy broccoli stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Blanch broccoli in boiling water for 2 minutes, then drain and set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry for 2 minutes until fragrant. Add bell pepper and broccoli and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes until tender-crisp. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, chili paste, honey, and water. Pour sauce over vegetables and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another 2 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts and garnish with cilantro. Serve hot with steamed jasmine or basmati rice.
ingredients: broccoli, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, soy sauce, peanut butter, chili paste, honey, water, peanuts, cilantro, jasmine rice, basmati rice

title: Chili ginger brownies with african-asian twist
directions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and line a baking pan with parchment paper. Melt chocolate and butter together in a heatproof bowl over simmering water. Remove from heat and stir in brown sugar until well combined. Beat in eggs one at a time, then add vanilla extract and rooibos tea. Sift in flour, baking powder, salt, chili powder, and fold gently. Stir in grated ginger and chopped roasted peanuts. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out with moist crumbs. Cool completely in the pan before slicing into squares. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: chocolate, butter, brown sugar, eggs, vanilla extract, rooibos tea, flour, baking powder, salt, chili powder, ginger, roasted peanuts

title: Spiced ginger sesame cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. Cream together butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, honey, and water until well combined. In a separate bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon, and cardamom. Gradually mix dry ingredients into the wet mixture to form a dough. Fold in sesame seeds evenly throughout the dough. Scoop tablespoon-sized portions and roll into balls. Place on tray and flatten slightly with your fingers. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown at the edges. Cool on tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack.
ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, honey, water, flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, sesame seeds

title: African asian fusion meatballs
directions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, egg, coriander, garlic, ginger, chili, soy sauce, suya spice, and breadcrumbs. Mix thoroughly until all ingredients are well incorporated. Form the mixture into small meatballs, about the size of a walnut. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Fry meatballs in batches until browned on all sides, about 6 to 8 minutes. Remove meatballs and set aside. In the same skillet, add sesame oil, tomato paste, and cook for 1 minute. Stir in coconut milk and fish sauce, then bring to a gentle simmer. Return meatballs to the skillet and simmer in the sauce for 10 minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: ground beef, egg, coriander, garlic, ginger, chili, soy sauce, suya spice, breadcrumbs, vegetable oil, sesame oil, tomato paste, coconut milk, fish sauce, steamed rice, flatbread

title: Healthy african-asian chickpea stir-fry
directions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Grill red onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and green beans, and cook until slightly tender. Stir in chickpeas and cook for 3 minutes. In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, peanut butter, cumin, and lime juice. Pour sauce over the vegetables and chickpeas, stirring to coat evenly. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add chili flakes if using and adjust seasoning to taste. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped cilantro. Serve warm over cooked brown rice.
ingredients: olive oil, red onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, green beans, chickpeas, soy sauce, peanut butter, cumin, lime juice, chili flakes, cilantro, brown rice

title: Spicy gnocchi with coconut peanut sauce
directions: Cook the gnocchi in boiling salted water until they float, then drain. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and Grill onion until soft. Add garlic, ginger, and chili and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Whisk in peanut butter, soy sauce, and lime juice until smooth. Simmer the sauce for 3 to 5 minutes until slightly thickened. Add the cooked gnocchi to the sauce and toss to coat evenly. Season with salt to taste and heat through for 2 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro and crushed peanuts before serving.
ingredients: gnocchi, salted water, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, salt, cilantro, crushed peanuts

title: Spicy kale and peanut stir-fry
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili and Grill until fragrant. Add tofu cubes and cook until lightly browned on all sides. Stir in chopped kale and cook until wilted, about 3 to 4 minutes. In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, peanut butter, sesame oil, and water until smooth. Pour sauce over the kale mixture and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt to taste and remove from heat. Top with chopped roasted peanuts before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, tofu, kale, soy sauce, peanut butter, sesame oil, water, salt, roasted peanuts, rice, flatbread

title: African asian chicken skewers in hot air fryer
directions: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, peanut butter, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, paprika, coriander, honey, and oil. Add chicken pieces to the marinade and coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Thread marinated chicken, bell pepper, and onion onto skewers. Preheat hot air fryer to 200°C (390°F). Place skewers in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Cook for 12 to 15 minutes, turning halfway through, until chicken is cooked through. Remove and let rest for 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: soy sauce, peanut butter, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, paprika, coriander, honey, oil, chicken, bell pepper, onion, fresh cilantro

title: Spiced coconut plantain cake with ginger glaze
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a small cake pan. In a bowl, whisk together mashed plantains, sugar, and eggs. Stir in coconut milk, oil, lime juice, and grated ginger. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, cardamom, and cinnamon. Add dry ingredients to wet mixture and stir until just combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool cake in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a rack. Mix powdered sugar and water to make a glaze. Drizzle glaze over cooled cake before serving.
ingredients: plantains, sugar, eggs, coconut milk, oil, lime juice, grated ginger, flour, baking powder, salt, cardamom, cinnamon, powdered sugar, water

title: Mango ginger cheesecake with coconut crust
directions: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F) and line a 20 cm (8-inch) springform pan with parchment paper. Combine crushed biscuits with melted butter and press into the bottom of the pan. Bake the crust for 10 minutes, then let cool completely. In a bowl, beat cream cheese with sugar until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in coconut milk, vanilla extract, grated ginger, and a pinch of salt. Fold in mango puree and cornstarch until fully incorporated. Pour filling over the cooled crust and smooth the top. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes until center is just set. Cool to room temperature, then chill for at least 4 hours before garnishing and serving.
ingredients: biscuits, butter, cream cheese, sugar, eggs, coconut milk, vanilla extract, ginger, salt, mango puree, cornstarch

title: Pumpkin coconut curry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add garlic, ginger, curry powder, and coriander, and cook for 1 minute. Stir in pumpkin cubes and cook for another 3 minutes. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Add peanut butter and soy sauce, stirring until smooth. Add chickpeas and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes until pumpkin is tender. Season with salt and add sliced chili if using. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, coriander, pumpkin, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, chickpeas, salt, chili, cilantro, rice, flatbread

title: Low carb african-asian cauliflower stir fry
directions: Heat sesame oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger, Grill until fragrant. Add diced chicken and cook until browned and fully cooked. Stir in bell pepper and green beans, cook until slightly tender. Add grated cauliflower and cook, stirring frequently, for 5 minutes. Sprinkle in berbere spice and stir to combine. Pour in soy sauce and fish sauce, tossing everything together. Cook for another 2 minutes until flavors are absorbed. Top with ground peanuts and sliced spring onions. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: sesame oil, garlic, ginger, chicken, bell pepper, green beans, cauliflower, berbere spice, soy sauce, fish sauce, peanuts, spring onions, coriander

title: Ginger lemongrass mojito with african mint
directions: Muddle mint leaves, grated ginger, lemongrass, and brown sugar in a sturdy glass or cocktail shaker. Add fresh lime juice and white rum to the muddled mixture. Fill four glasses with ice cubes. Strain the mint-ginger-lime mixture evenly into the glasses. Top each glass with soda water and stir gently to combine. Garnish with lime slices and mint sprigs. Serve immediately while chilled.
ingredients: mint leaves, grated ginger, lemongrass, brown sugar, fresh lime juice, white rum, ice cubes, soda water, lime slices, mint sprigs

title: Spicy stir-fried brussels sprouts with peanut sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add red onion and Grill until softened. Stir in garlic, ginger, and chili and cook for 1 minute. Add Brussels sprouts and stir-fry until browned and tender, about 8 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, peanut butter, water, and honey. Pour the sauce over the sprouts and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another 2 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped peanuts. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: vegetable oil, red onion, garlic, ginger, chili, Brussels sprouts, soy sauce, rice vinegar, peanut butter, water, honey, peanuts, cilantro

title: African-asian fusion kaesespaetzle
directions: Combine flour, eggs, water, and salt in a bowl to form a thick batter. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Press batter through a spaetzle maker or colander into the boiling water. Cook spaetzle until they float, then remove and drain. Heat oil in a pan and Grill onions until golden and caramelized. Add garlic, ginger, and chili, cooking for another 2 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and butter, then add the cooked spaetzle. Mix in Gouda and cheddar until melted and creamy. Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
ingredients: flour, eggs, water, salt, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, chili, soy sauce, butter, spaetzle, Gouda, cheddar, cilantro

title: Savory african-asian fusion waffles
directions: Preheat the waffle iron and lightly grease with cooking spray or oil. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar. In another bowl, beat the egg and mix in coconut milk and vegetable oil. Combine the wet and dry ingredients until just mixed. Fold in grated sweet potato, scallions, ginger, coriander, and chili flakes. Let the batter rest for 5 minutes to thicken slightly. Pour batter into the preheated waffle iron, spreading evenly. Cook until golden brown and crisp, following your waffle iron's instructions. Transfer waffles to a warm plate and repeat with remaining batter. Serve hot with your choice of dipping sauce or chutney.
ingredients: cooking spray, flour, baking powder, salt, sugar, egg, coconut milk, vegetable oil, sweet potato, scallions, ginger, coriander, chili flakes

title: Spiced chicken puff pastry with peanut sauce
directions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add shredded chicken, soy sauce, peanut butter, curry powder, and chili flakes. Stir well and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until mixture is heated through and thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste, then let the filling cool slightly. Cut each puff pastry sheet into 4 equal squares. Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of each square. Fold pastry over to form a triangle and press edges to seal. Brush tops with beaten egg and place on prepared tray. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until golden and puffed.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, shredded chicken, soy sauce, peanut butter, curry powder, chili flakes, salt, pepper, puff pastry, beaten egg

title: Dutch oven african-asian chicken curry
directions: Preheat the Dutch oven over medium heat with oil. Grill chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add curry powder, ground coriander, and turmeric, stirring for 1 minute. Add chicken thighs and brown on all sides. Stir in chopped tomatoes, coconut milk, and peanut butter. Add diced sweet potatoes and season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer on low heat for 45 minutes until chicken is tender. Stir in chopped spinach and cook until wilted. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, onions, garlic, ginger, curry powder, ground coriander, turmeric, chicken thighs, tomatoes, coconut milk, peanut butter, sweet potatoes, salt, pepper, spinach, cilantro, rice, flatbread

title: African-asian spiced semolina porridge
directions: Heat ghee in a saucepan over medium heat. Add semolina and stir continuously for 3 to 4 minutes until lightly golden. In a separate pot, combine milk and water and bring to a gentle simmer. Slowly pour the warm liquid into the semolina while stirring to avoid lumps. Add palm sugar, cardamom, ginger, nutmeg, and salt to the mixture. Cook over low heat for 6 to 8 minutes, stirring constantly, until thickened. Stir in coconut flakes and remove from heat. Let sit for 2 minutes to finish thickening. Serve warm topped with banana slices and crushed peanuts.
ingredients: ghee, semolina, milk, water, palm sugar, cardamom, ginger, nutmeg, salt, coconut flakes, banana, peanuts

title: Spicy guacamole with african-asian twist
directions: Cut the avocados in half, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a bowl. Mash the avocado with a fork until slightly chunky. Add the chopped red onion, diced tomato, and minced chili to the bowl. Stir in the garlic, grated ginger, and lime juice. Pour in the soy sauce and mix well to combine. Add the chopped cilantro and mint for freshness. Sprinkle in the ground coriander, salt, and black pepper. Mix all ingredients until evenly combined. Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. Serve immediately with flatbread or vegetable sticks.
ingredients: avocado, red onion, tomato, chili, garlic, ginger, lime juice, soy sauce, cilantro, mint, ground coriander, salt, black pepper, flatbread, vegetable sticks

title: Spiced potato gratin with coconut and curry
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Heat oil in a pan and Grill onion until soft. Add garlic, curry powder, ginger, turmeric, and chili flakes. Cook for 2 minutes until fragrant. Stir in coconut milk and heavy cream, then season with salt and pepper. Simmer sauce for 3 minutes, then remove from heat. Layer half the sliced potatoes in a greased baking dish. Pour half the sauce over the potatoes. Repeat layering with remaining potatoes and sauce. Top with grated cheese if using and bake for 45 minutes until golden and tender.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, curry powder, ginger, turmeric, chili flakes, coconut milk, heavy cream, salt, pepper, potatoes, grated cheese

title: Coconut cardamom rice pudding with mango
directions: Rinse the jasmine rice under cold water until the water runs clear. In a medium saucepan, combine rice, coconut milk, and water. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce to low and simmer uncovered. Stir occasionally and cook until rice is soft and mixture thickens, about 25 minutes. Add brown sugar, cardamom, salt, and vanilla extract. Stir well and cook for another 5 minutes until fully combined. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Spoon into serving bowls and top with diced mango. Garnish with toasted coconut flakes and chopped pistachios if using. Serve warm or chilled as desired.
ingredients: jasmine rice, coconut milk, water, brown sugar, cardamom, salt, vanilla extract, mango, toasted coconut flakes, pistachios

title: Spicy asparagus stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant. Add red onion and bell pepper, stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add asparagus and cook for another 3 to 4 minutes until just tender. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, chili paste, lime juice, brown sugar, and water. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir well to coat. Cook for 2 more minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot over steamed rice.
ingredients: vegetable oil, garlic, ginger, red onion, bell pepper, asparagus, soy sauce, peanut butter, chili paste, lime juice, brown sugar, water, fresh coriander leaves, steamed rice

title: Stir-fried pointed cabbage with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili, then Grill until fragrant. Stir in the shredded pointed cabbage and cook until slightly wilted. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, brown sugar, and lime juice. Pour the sauce into the pan and toss to coat the cabbage evenly. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes until cabbage is tender-crisp and sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt to taste and remove from heat. Garnish with chopped roasted peanuts and fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, pointed cabbage, soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, brown sugar, lime juice, salt, roasted peanuts, fresh coriander

title: Vanilla crescents with cardamom and coconut
directions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a bowl, mix flour, ground almonds, coconut, cardamom, and salt. In another bowl, cream butter, vanilla extract, and powdered sugar until smooth. Gradually add dry ingredients to the butter mixture and mix until a soft dough forms. Chill the dough in the refrigerator for 30 minutes. Take small portions and shape into crescent moons. Place crescents on the baking sheet, spacing them slightly apart. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden. Let cool on the tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack. Dust cooled crescents with extra powdered sugar before serving.
ingredients: flour, ground almonds, coconut, cardamom, salt, butter, vanilla extract, powdered sugar

title: Vegetarian african-asian peanut curry
directions: Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill the onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic, ginger, cumin, and curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Stir in chickpeas, sweet potatoes, and eggplant. Pour in the coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Add peanut butter and soy sauce, stirring until combined. Cover and cook for 15 to 20 minutes until vegetables are tender. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin, curry powder, chickpeas, sweet potatoes, eggplant, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, spinach, salt, pepper, steamed rice, flatbread

title: Savoy cabbage stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok over medium-high heat. Add tofu cubes and fry until golden on all sides, then remove and set aside. In the same wok, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add sliced savoy cabbage and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes until slightly softened. In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, fish sauce, peanut butter, rice vinegar, chili flakes, and water until smooth. Pour the sauce over the cabbage and stir to coat evenly. Return tofu to the wok and cook for another 2 minutes to heat through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped spring onions and cilantro. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vegetable oil, tofu, onion, garlic, ginger, savoy cabbage, soy sauce, fish sauce, peanut butter, rice vinegar, chili flakes, water, spring onions, cilantro, steamed rice, flatbread

title: Spicy aubergine stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili and Grill until fragrant. Add aubergine cubes and cook until softened and lightly browned. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, peanut butter, coconut milk, and honey. Pour the sauce over the aubergines and stir to coat evenly. Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes until the sauce thickens and aubergines are tender. Adjust seasoning if needed and remove from heat. Garnish with chopped spring onions and coriander. Serve hot over cooked jasmine rice.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, aubergine, soy sauce, rice vinegar, peanut butter, coconut milk, honey, spring onions, coriander, jasmine rice

title: Avocado and peanut noodle salad
directions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions, then drain and rinse with cold water. In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, grated ginger, garlic, honey, and a pinch of salt. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked noodles, carrots, cucumber, and bell pepper. Pour the dressing over the noodle mixture and toss gently to coat. Add diced avocado and chopped peanuts to the bowl. Carefully mix to combine without mashing the avocado. Sprinkle chopped cilantro over the salad. Chill for 15 minutes before serving for best flavor. Serve in bowls and garnish with extra peanuts if desired.
ingredients: rice noodles, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, honey, salt, carrots, cucumber, bell pepper, avocado, peanuts, cilantro

title: Butternut squash curry with coconut and peanut
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. Stir in red curry paste and cumin, cook for another minute. Add butternut squash and stir to coat with spices. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Stir in peanut butter and soy sauce until well combined. Cover and simmer until squash is tender, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and adjust to taste. Serve hot over jasmine rice and garnish with fresh coriander.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, red curry paste, cumin, butternut squash, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, salt, jasmine rice, fresh coriander

title: Spicy garlic soup with coconut and ginger
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, ginger, and chili and Grill until fragrant. Stir in ground coriander and turmeric and cook for 1 minute. Pour in coconut milk and vegetable broth. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add soy sauce and lemon juice, then season with salt and pepper. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Simmer for another 5 minutes to blend flavors. Ladle into bowls and garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with flatbread or rice on the side.
ingredients: oil, garlic, onion, ginger, chili, ground coriander, turmeric, coconut milk, vegetable broth, soy sauce, lemon juice, salt, pepper, cilantro, flatbread, rice

title: Creamy egg liqueur chai custard
directions: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat until steaming. Add tea, cardamom, ginger, and cloves, then steep for 5 minutes. Strain the spiced milk and return it to the pan. In a bowl, whisk egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, and salt until smooth. Slowly pour the warm milk into the egg mixture while whisking constantly. Return mixture to the saucepan and cook over low heat, stirring until thickened. Remove from heat and stir in egg liqueur and vanilla extract. Pour into serving bowls and let cool to room temperature. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
ingredients: milk, tea, cardamom, ginger, cloves, egg yolks, sugar, cornstarch, salt, egg liqueur, vanilla extract

title: Spiced duck breast with mango coconut sauce
directions: Score the duck breast skin and season with coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Place duck breasts skin-side down in a cold pan and cook over medium heat until fat renders and skin is crisp. Flip and cook the other side for 3 to 4 minutes until medium rare or desired doneness. Remove duck and let rest covered for 5 minutes. In a saucepan, heat oil and Grill garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add mango, coconut milk, soy sauce, and lime juice. Simmer sauce for 5 to 7 minutes until slightly thickened, then blend until smooth. Slice duck breasts thinly across the grain. Serve duck over the sauce and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
ingredients: duck breast, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, oil, garlic, ginger, mango, coconut milk, soy sauce, lime juice

title: Spicy roasted almonds with african-asian flavors
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a mixing bowl, combine sesame oil, soy sauce, berbere spice, ginger, garlic powder, cayenne, brown sugar, and salt. Add almonds to the bowl and toss until evenly coated with the spice mixture. Spread coated almonds in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Roast in the oven for 12 to 15 minutes, stirring once halfway through. Remove from oven and let cool completely on the baking sheet. Store in an airtight container once fully cooled.
ingredients: sesame oil, soy sauce, berbere spice, ginger, garlic powder, cayenne, brown sugar, salt, almonds

title: Spicy african-asian potato salad
directions: Boil the potatoes in salted water until tender, about 10 to 12 minutes. Drain and let the potatoes cool completely. In a large bowl, combine the rice vinegar, sesame oil, mayonnaise, mustard, and chili flakes. Whisk until the dressing is smooth and well blended. Add the cooled potatoes, edamame, red onion, and carrot to the bowl. Toss gently to coat all ingredients with the dressing. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Sprinkle chopped cilantro and mint over the salad. Chill for 30 minutes before serving. Serve cold or at room temperature.
ingredients: potatoes, salt, rice vinegar, sesame oil, mayonnaise, mustard, chili flakes, edamame, red onion, carrot, black pepper, cilantro, mint

title: Spicy kimchi jollof fried rice
directions: Rinse and drain the rice thoroughly. Cook rice with water, salt, and a bay leaf until tender, then set aside. Heat oil in a large pan and Grill onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add chopped bell peppers and cook until slightly softened. Stir in tomato paste and cook for a few minutes to reduce acidity. Mix in chopped kimchi and a splash of kimchi juice, cooking for 2 minutes. Add cooked rice and stir-fry until evenly coated and heated through. Season with soy sauce, chili flakes, and a pinch of sugar to balance flavors. Toss in chopped scallions and cook for another minute. Serve hot, optionally topped with a fried egg or sliced grilled chicken.
ingredients: rice, water, salt, bay leaf, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, bell peppers, tomato paste, kimchi, kimchi juice, soy sauce, chili flakes, sugar, scallions, fried egg, grilled chicken

title: Spicy kohlrabi stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and Grill until fragrant. Stir in kohlrabi and bell pepper and cook until slightly tender. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili paste, peanut butter, and coconut milk. Pour the sauce into the wok and toss to coat vegetables evenly. Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot over steamed rice.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, kohlrabi, bell pepper, soy sauce, rice vinegar, chili paste, peanut butter, coconut milk, salt, fresh cilantro, steamed rice

title: Coconut ginger macaroons with cardamom
directions: Preheat oven to 170°C (340°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. In a bowl, mix desiccated coconut, condensed milk, ginger, cardamom, salt, and vanilla extract. In a separate bowl, whisk egg whites until soft peaks form. Gradually add sugar to egg whites and continue whisking until glossy. Gently fold the egg white mixture into the coconut mixture until combined. Scoop heaped tablespoons of the mixture onto the prepared tray, spacing them apart. Bake for 18 to 20 minutes until golden brown on the edges. Let cool on the tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
ingredients: desiccated coconut, condensed milk, ginger, cardamom, salt, vanilla extract, egg whites, sugar

title: African asian spiced grilled salmon
directions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, cumin, paprika, chili, honey, and vegetable oil. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper. Place salmon in a shallow dish and pour the marinade over. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Preheat grill or grill pan over medium heat. Grill salmon for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until cooked through. Transfer to a serving plate and garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side.
ingredients: soy sauce, peanut butter, lemon juice, ginger, garlic, cumin, paprika, chili, honey, vegetable oil, salt, pepper, salmon fillets, fresh coriander, lemon wedges

title: Spiced coconut plantain muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a muffin tin with paper liners. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices. In a separate bowl, mix mashed plantains, sugar, eggs, coconut milk, and oil until smooth. Gradually fold the wet mixture into the dry ingredients until just combined. Stir in desiccated coconut without overmixing. Spoon batter evenly into prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full. Bake for 18 to 22 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Let muffins cool in the tin for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, spices, plantains, sugar, eggs, coconut milk, oil, desiccated coconut

title: Spiced african-asian fusion millet porridge
directions: Rinse the millet thoroughly under cold running water. In a pot, combine millet and water, then bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add coconut milk, ground peanuts, ginger, cardamom, and salt. Cook for another 10 to 15 minutes until thick and creamy. Stir in honey or palm sugar until fully dissolved. Remove from heat and let sit for 5 minutes. Spoon into bowls and top with sliced banana. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds and mint if using. Serve warm for breakfast or as a comforting snack.
ingredients: millet, water, coconut milk, ground peanuts, ginger, cardamom, salt, honey, palm sugar, banana, toasted sesame seeds, mint

title: Spiced chicken quiche with coconut curry twist
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Line a 23 cm (9 inch) pie dish with the shortcrust pastry and prick the base with a fork. Blind bake the pastry for 10 minutes, then remove and let cool. Heat oil in a pan and Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until softened. Add curry powder and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in shredded chicken and coconut milk, cook until slightly thickened. In a bowl, whisk eggs with whole milk, salt, and pepper. Spread chicken mixture evenly over the pastry base. Pour egg mixture over the filling and sprinkle with chopped coriander. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until set and golden on top.
ingredients: shortcrust pastry, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, shredded chicken, coconut milk, eggs, whole milk, salt, pepper, coriander

title: Spicy african peanut ramen bowl
directions: Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions and set aside. Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Grill garlic, ginger, onion, and chili until fragrant. Add shredded chicken and stir to combine. Pour in chicken broth and coconut milk. Stir in peanut butter, soy sauce, and ground coriander. Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes until slightly thickened. Add cooked noodles and toss to coat with broth. Serve hot topped with spring onions and fresh cilantro.
ingredients: ramen noodles, oil, garlic, ginger, onion, chili, shredded chicken, chicken broth, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, ground coriander, spring onions, fresh cilantro

title: Spicy african-asian fusion risotto
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant. Add arborio rice and stir to coat with the oil and aromatics. Pour in a ladle of warm broth and stir until absorbed. Continue adding broth gradually, stirring constantly until rice is al dente. Stir in coconut milk, cooked chicken or tofu, coriander, turmeric, and soy sauce. Simmer until creamy and fully heated through. Fold in baby spinach and let it wilt. Remove from heat and let sit for 2 minutes. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, arborio rice, broth, coconut milk, cooked chicken, tofu, coriander, turmeric, soy sauce, baby spinach, fresh cilantro

title: Spicy african-asian fusion chicken salad
directions: In a large bowl, combine chicken, mango, red onion, cucumber, and carrot. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, soy sauce, peanut oil, harissa paste, ginger, lime juice, and salt. Pour the dressing over the salad ingredients. Toss gently to coat all ingredients evenly. Sprinkle crushed peanuts and chopped cilantro over the salad. Let the salad sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
ingredients: chicken, mango, red onion, cucumber, carrot, rice vinegar, soy sauce, peanut oil, harissa paste, ginger, lime juice, salt, crushed peanuts, cilantro

title: Semmelknoedel with spicy coconut peanut sauce
directions: Heat butter in a pan and Grill onion until translucent, then let cool. In a large bowl, combine bread cubes with warm milk and let soak for 10 minutes. Add eggs, Grilled onion, parsley, salt, and pepper to the bread mixture and mix well. Form the mixture into firm dumplings using damp hands. Bring a large pot of salted water to a gentle simmer. Carefully drop dumplings into the water and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes until cooked through. In a saucepan, combine peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and chili paste. Heat gently, stirring until smooth and slightly thickened, then season to taste. Remove dumplings with a slotted spoon and drain briefly. Serve dumplings warm with the spicy coconut peanut sauce spooned over.
ingredients: butter, onion, bread cubes, milk, eggs, parsley, salt, pepper, peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chili paste

title: Grilled african-asian fusion stick bread
directions: In a mixing bowl, combine flour, yeast, sugar, salt, ginger, coriander, and chili flakes. Add warm water, yogurt, and sesame oil to the dry ingredients and mix into a soft dough. Knead the dough for 8 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover and let the dough rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Punch down the dough and mix in scallions and cilantro. Divide the dough into 8 equal pieces and roll each into a rope about 30 cm (12 in) long. Wrap each rope around a clean, oiled stick or skewer in a spiral. Grill the stick breads over medium heat, turning frequently, for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Serve warm with dipping sauce or grilled meat.
ingredients: flour, yeast, sugar, salt, ginger, coriander, chili flakes, warm water, yogurt, sesame oil, scallions, cilantro

title: Spicy african-asian chicken with garlic aioli
directions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, harissa paste, sesame oil, minced garlic, ground ginger, and lemon juice. Add chicken strips to the marinade and mix well to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook marinated chicken for 8 to 10 minutes until golden and cooked through. In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise, grated garlic, rice vinegar, and chili powder to make the aioli. Season aioli with salt and pepper to taste. Serve chicken hot, garnished with chopped cilantro. Offer garlic aioli on the side for dipping or drizzling.
ingredients: soy sauce, harissa paste, sesame oil, minced garlic, ground ginger, lemon juice, chicken strips, vegetable oil, mayonnaise, grated garlic, rice vinegar, chili powder, salt, pepper, cilantro

title: Spicy african-asian chicken casserole
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned. Stir in cumin, curry powder, tomato paste, and soy sauce. Pour in coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes. Mix in cooked rice and peas until combined. Transfer mixture to a greased casserole dish. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes until bubbly and golden. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, chicken, cumin, curry powder, tomato paste, soy sauce, coconut milk, rice, peas, fresh coriander

title: Stir-fried chinese cabbage with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and Grill until fragrant. Add tofu cubes and cook until lightly browned on all sides. Stir in Chinese cabbage and cook until wilted. In a small bowl, whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, chili flakes, and water until smooth. Pour the sauce into the pan and stir to coat evenly. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt to taste. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts and garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, tofu, Chinese cabbage, peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, chili flakes, water, salt, peanuts, coriander, rice, flatbread

title: African-asian inspired espresso martini
directions: Brew fresh espresso and allow it to cool completely. In a cocktail shaker, combine espresso, vodka, coffee liqueur, baobab powder, cardamom, and palm sugar syrup. Add a generous handful of ice to the shaker. Shake vigorously for 15 to 20 seconds until well chilled and frothy. Strain the mixture evenly into four chilled martini glasses. Garnish each with a few whole coffee beans. Serve immediately while cold and frothy.
ingredients: espresso, vodka, coffee liqueur, baobab powder, cardamom, palm sugar syrup, ice, coffee beans

title: Spiced african-asian fusion falafel wraps
directions: Place chickpeas, onion, garlic, ginger, cilantro, parsley, and spices in a food processor. Blend until mixture is coarse and holds together when pressed. Add flour, season with salt and pepper, and pulse to combine. Form mixture into small balls or patties using damp hands. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fry falafel in batches until golden brown and crispy on all sides. Drain falafel on paper towels. Warm flatbreads in a dry skillet or oven. Fill each flatbread with falafel, cabbage, pickled vegetables, and peanut sauce. Serve immediately while warm.
ingredients: chickpeas, onion, garlic, ginger, cilantro, parsley, spices, flour, salt, pepper, oil, flatbreads, cabbage, pickled vegetables, peanut sauce

title: Spiced fennel stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger and Grill until fragrant. Add tofu and cook until golden on all sides. Stir in fennel, bell pepper, and carrot and cook until just tender. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, chili paste, and lime juice. Pour sauce into the skillet and toss to coat evenly. Cook for 2 more minutes until vegetables are glazed and heated through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped peanuts and green onions. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, garlic, ginger, tofu, fennel, bell pepper, carrot, soy sauce, peanut butter, chili paste, lime juice, peanuts, green onions, cilantro, rice, flatbread

title: Spiced focaccia with berbere and sesame oil
directions: In a large bowl, mix flour, salt, and yeast. Gradually add warm water and olive oil, stirring to form a sticky dough. Knead the dough on a floured surface for 8 to 10 minutes until smooth. Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover, and let rise for 1 hour until doubled. Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F) and oil a baking tray. Stretch dough onto tray, pressing with fingers to create dimples. Drizzle with sesame oil and sprinkle with berbere, garlic, onion, and sesame seeds. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until golden and crisp on top. Cool slightly on a wire rack. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: flour, salt, yeast, warm water, olive oil, sesame oil, berbere, garlic, onion, sesame seeds, fresh coriander

title: Spicy african-asian cucumber salad
directions: Place cucumber and red onion slices in a large mixing bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, and sugar. Add grated ginger and chopped chili to the dressing and mix well. Pour the dressing over the cucumber and onion mixture. Toss gently to coat all the vegetables evenly. Let the salad sit for 10 minutes to allow flavors to meld. Sprinkle chopped cilantro and ground peanuts on top before serving. Serve chilled or at room temperature.
ingredients: cucumber, red onion, rice vinegar, lime juice, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, ginger, chili, cilantro, peanuts

title: Spicy ginger shot with hibiscus and lemongrass
directions: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add ginger, hibiscus petals, and lemongrass to the boiling water. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let steep for another 5 minutes. Strain the mixture into a heatproof container. Stir in lime juice, honey, cayenne pepper, and salt. Let the liquid cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Shake well before pouring into shot glasses. Serve chilled and consume within 3 days.
ingredients: water, ginger, hibiscus petals, lemongrass, lime juice, honey, cayenne pepper, salt

title: Sweet potato coconut curry stir-fry
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion and Grill until soft and translucent. Stir in garlic, ginger, and chili and cook for 1 minute. Add diced sweet potatoes and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix in bell pepper, coriander, and cumin and stir well. Pour in coconut milk and soy sauce and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 to 12 minutes until sweet potatoes are tender. Uncover and simmer for 2 more minutes to thicken slightly. Season with salt to taste. Serve hot over jasmine rice and garnish with fresh cilantro.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, sweet potatoes, bell pepper, coriander, cumin, coconut milk, soy sauce, salt, jasmine rice, cilantro

title: Keto african-asian chicken stir-fry
directions: Heat coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same skillet, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and green beans and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. Return chicken to the skillet and stir to combine. Add soy sauce, fish sauce, coriander, and chili flakes. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until everything is well coated and heated through. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and chopped cilantro before serving. Serve hot as a standalone keto-friendly meal.
ingredients: coconut oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, green beans, soy sauce, fish sauce, coriander, chili flakes, sesame seeds, cilantro

title: African-asian chicken meal prep bowls
directions: Mix soy sauce, peanut butter, ginger, garlic, and cumin in a bowl. Add diced chicken and marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a pan and cook chicken until browned and cooked through. In a separate pan, Grill bell pepper and zucchini in sesame oil until tender-crisp. Combine cooked jasmine rice and jollof rice in a large bowl. Divide rice mixture evenly into four meal prep containers. Top each container with Grilled vegetables and cooked chicken. Sprinkle with chopped spring onions and drizzle with lime juice. Let cool before sealing containers and refrigerate. Reheat in microwave before serving.
ingredients: soy sauce, peanut butter, ginger, garlic, cumin, chicken, vegetable oil, bell pepper, zucchini, sesame oil, jasmine rice, jollof rice, spring onions, lime juice

title: Spiced nut corners with ginger and sesame
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. In a saucepan, melt butter over low heat and stir in honey and brown sugar. Add ginger, cardamom, and salt, and cook for 2 minutes until slightly thickened. Stir in chopped nuts and sesame seeds until fully coated. Lay out the phyllo pastry and brush lightly with vegetable oil. Spread the nut mixture evenly over the pastry, leaving a small border. Fold the pastry over the filling and press gently to seal. Cut into triangle-shaped corners and place on the prepared baking tray. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes until golden and crisp. Cool completely before serving to allow the filling to set.
ingredients: butter, honey, brown sugar, ginger, cardamom, salt, nuts, sesame seeds, phyllo pastry, vegetable oil

title: Spicy african-asian fusion pizzabrÃ¶tchen
directions: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F). Slice the tops off the bread rolls and hollow out the centers slightly. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and Grill onion and garlic until soft. Add ground beef, cook until browned, then stir in gochujang and berbere spice. Season with salt and pepper, then remove from heat and let cool slightly. In a bowl, mix mayonnaise with soy sauce and chopped coriander. Fill bread rolls with beef mixture, top with shredded cabbage and cheese. Place filled rolls on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until cheese is melted and golden. Drizzle with coriander mayo before serving.
ingredients: bread rolls, oil, onion, garlic, ground beef, gochujang, berbere spice, salt, pepper, mayonnaise, soy sauce, coriander, cabbage, cheese, parchment paper

title: African-asian fusion plaetzchen cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cream together butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and honey until fully incorporated. In a separate bowl, mix flour, ground peanuts, baking powder, salt, ginger, and cardamom. Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet mixture and mix to form a dough. Scoop small portions of dough and roll into balls. Flatten each ball slightly and place on the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top of each cookie. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack before serving.
ingredients: butter, brown sugar, egg, honey, flour, ground peanuts, baking powder, salt, ginger, cardamom, sesame seeds

title: Spicy rewe stir-fry with ginger peanut sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant. Add tofu cubes and cook until lightly golden. Stir in carrots and cook for 3 minutes. Add chopped rewe leaves and cook until wilted. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, sesame oil, and lime juice. Pour the sauce over the stir-fry and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes until heated through. Adjust seasoning if needed. Serve hot with jasmine rice.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, tofu, carrots, rewe leaves, soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, sesame oil, lime juice, jasmine rice

title: Spiced chicken roulades with coconut peanut sauce
directions: Butterfly each chicken breast and flatten slightly with a mallet. Season chicken with coriander, ginger, turmeric, chili flakes, and salt. In a skillet, heat 1  oil and Grill spinach and carrot until wilted. Place spinach mixture and cilantro on each chicken breast and roll tightly. Secure roulades with toothpicks or kitchen twine. Heat remaining oil in a skillet and brown roulades on all sides. Cover and cook over low heat for 10 to 12 minutes until cooked through. In a saucepan, combine coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, garlic, and lime juice. Simmer sauce for 5 minutes until slightly thickened. Slice roulades and serve with warm coconut peanut sauce.
ingredients: chicken breast, coriander, ginger, turmeric, chili flakes, salt, oil, spinach, carrot, cilantro, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, garlic, lime juice

title: African asian fusion ruehrei with spiced tofu
directions: Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Grill onion, chili, and ginger-garlic paste until fragrant. Add tofu and cook until lightly browned. Stir in turmeric, curry powder, and soy sauce. Add diced tomato and cook until softened. Beat eggs in a bowl with salt and pepper. Pour eggs into the skillet and let set slightly. Gently scramble until just cooked through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped coriander. Serve warm with flatbread or steamed rice.
ingredients: oil, onion, chili, ginger-garlic paste, tofu, turmeric, curry powder, soy sauce, tomato, eggs, salt, pepper, coriander, flatbread, rice

title: African-asian sauerbraten fusion stew
directions: Combine vinegar, water, soy sauce, ginger, coriander, garlic, onion, tomato paste, brown sugar, cloves, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add beef chunks to the marinade and refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight. Remove beef from marinade and pat dry, reserving the marinade. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sear beef chunks on all sides until browned. Pour reserved marinade into the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 2 hours or until beef is tender. Stir occasionally and add water if needed to maintain liquid level. Adjust seasoning to taste before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vinegar, water, soy sauce, ginger, coriander, garlic, onion, tomato paste, brown sugar, cloves, salt, pepper, beef chunks, oil, steamed rice, flatbread

title: Spicy sauerkraut stir-fry with tofu and peanuts
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add tofu cubes and fry until golden on all sides, then set aside. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant and softened. Stir in sauerkraut and cook for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Return tofu to the pan and mix well. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, peanut butter, and sesame oil. Pour the sauce into the pan and toss to coat evenly. Cook for another 2 minutes until heated through. Top with roasted peanuts and spring onions. Serve hot with cooked jasmine rice.
ingredients: vegetable oil, tofu, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, sauerkraut, soy sauce, peanut butter, sesame oil, roasted peanuts, spring onions, jasmine rice

title: Spicy pork fillet with peanut soy glaze
directions: Mix peanut butter, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, chili, honey, and lime juice in a bowl to make the glaze. Add pork slices to the glaze and marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated pork and cook until browned and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes. Remove pork and set aside. In the same skillet, Grill red onion and bell pepper until slightly tender. Return pork to the skillet and stir to combine with vegetables. Cook for another 2 minutes until heated through. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: peanut butter, soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, chili, honey, lime juice, pork, vegetable oil, red onion, bell pepper, fresh coriander, steamed rice

title: African-asian mango ginger smoothie
directions: Place the chopped mangoes and banana into a blender. Add the coconut milk and plain yogurt to the blender. Grate fresh ginger and add it along with ground turmeric. Squeeze in the lime juice and drizzle in the honey. Pour in cold water to adjust the consistency. Add a handful of ice cubes for a chilled texture. Blend on high until smooth and creamy. Taste and adjust sweetness or lime juice if needed. Pour into glasses and serve immediately. Garnish with a slice of lime or a sprinkle of turmeric if desired.
ingredients: mangoes, banana, coconut milk, plain yogurt, ginger, ground turmeric, lime juice, honey, cold water, ice cubes

title: African asian fusion solyanka soup
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Grill onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add curry powder, paprika, and stir to coat the aromatics. Stir in chopped beef, chicken, and smoked fish, and cook until lightly browned. Add tomato paste and cook for 2 minutes to deepen flavor. Pour in broth, soy sauce, and diced tomatoes, then bring to a simmer. Add sliced pickles, olives, and a splash of lemon juice. Simmer for 20 minutes until flavors meld together. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with fresh cilantro and a lemon wedge.
ingredients: oil, onions, garlic, ginger, curry powder, paprika, beef, chicken, smoked fish, tomato paste, broth, soy sauce, diced tomatoes, pickles, olives, lemon juice, salt, pepper, cilantro, lemon

title: Spicy african-asian tomato soup
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a pot over medium heat. Grill onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic, ginger, and chili, and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in cumin and coriander and cook for 1 minute. Add canned tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in coconut milk, soy sauce, and sugar. Blend the soup until smooth using an immersion blender. Season with salt and pepper, garnish with cilantro, and serve hot.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, cumin, coriander, canned tomatoes, vegetable broth, coconut milk, soy sauce, sugar, salt, pepper, cilantro

title: Spicy tzatziki with harissa and thai basil
directions: Grate the cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture using a clean cloth. In a bowl, combine Greek yogurt and grated cucumber. Add harissa paste, lime juice, and minced garlic to the yogurt mixture. Stir in chopped Thai basil, mint, and grated ginger. Season with ground cumin and salt to taste. Drizzle in olive oil and mix until well combined. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to let flavors meld. Stir before serving and garnish with extra herbs if desired. Serve chilled as a dip or sauce alongside grilled meats or vegetables.
ingredients: cucumber, Greek yogurt, harissa paste, lime juice, garlic, Thai basil, mint, ginger, ground cumin, salt, olive oil

title: Vegan african-asian peanut coconut stew
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add chopped onion and Grill until translucent. Stir in garlic, ginger, chili, and cumin and cook for 2 minutes. Add chickpeas and sweet potato and stir to coat with spices. Pour in coconut milk and diced tomatoes and mix well. Stir in peanut butter and soy sauce until fully combined. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 20 minutes until sweet potato is tender. Add chopped spinach and cook for another 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, cumin, chickpeas, sweet potato, coconut milk, diced tomatoes, peanut butter, soy sauce, spinach, salt

title: Lemon cake with ginger and coconut twist
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a loaf pan. Cream butter and sugar in a bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until well incorporated. Stir in lemon juice, lemon zest, coconut milk, and fresh ginger. In a separate bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, ground ginger, and salt. Gradually add dry ingredients to wet mixture and mix until smooth. Fold in desiccated coconut gently. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
ingredients: butter, sugar, eggs, lemon juice, lemon zest, coconut milk, fresh ginger, flour, baking powder, ground ginger, salt, desiccated coconut

title: Spicy chicken baguette with african-asian flavors
directions: Combine soy sauce, harissa paste, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic in a bowl. Add chicken slices to the marinade and let sit for 20 minutes. Heat a skillet over medium heat and cook marinated chicken until done. Mix mayonnaise with lime juice to make a tangy spread. Lightly toast the baguette halves until golden and crisp. Spread the lime mayo on the inside of each baguette half. Layer cooked chicken, red onion, carrot, and cucumber onto the bread. Top with fresh cilantro leaves for added flavor. Close the baguettes and press gently to secure the filling. Slice each filled baguette in half and serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredients: soy sauce, harissa paste, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, chicken, mayonnaise, lime juice, baguette, red onion, carrot, cucumber, cilantro

title: Spiced ginger chai sheet cake with coconut glaze
directions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and grease a 23x33 cm (9x13 inch) sheet pan. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, spices, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, beat eggs, oil, and chai tea until well combined. Gradually add wet ingredients to dry ingredients, stirring until smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared sheet pan and spread evenly. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the cake cool completely in the pan on a wire rack. In a small bowl, mix coconut milk and powdered sugar to make a glaze. Drizzle glaze over the cooled cake and spread evenly. Sprinkle with desiccated coconut before serving.
ingredients: flour, sugar, spices, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, oil, chai tea, coconut milk, powdered sugar, desiccated coconut

title: Spicy african-asian fusion rice bowl
directions: Cook jasmine rice according to package instructions and set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Add diced chicken and cook until browned and fully cooked. Stir in onion, garlic, and ginger and Grill until fragrant. Mix in harissa paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and brown sugar. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Add cabbage and carrot, stir-fry until just tender. Divide rice into bowls and top with chicken and vegetable mixture. Garnish with spring onions and fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: jasmine rice, vegetable oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, harissa paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, cabbage, carrot, spring onions, fresh cilantro

title: Spicy buckwheat stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Rinse buckwheat and cook in boiling water for 10 minutes until tender, then drain. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper, cabbage, and carrot, stir-fry for 5 minutes. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, chili paste, peanut butter, and water. Pour sauce over vegetables and stir well to coat. Add cooked buckwheat and toss everything together until heated through. Season with salt to taste. Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
ingredients: buckwheat, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, cabbage, carrot, soy sauce, chili paste, peanut butter, water, salt, cilantro

title: African asian fusion butter chicken
directions: Combine yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, coriander, turmeric, paprika, and berbere in a bowl. Add chicken to the marinade and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat and Grill onions until golden. Add the marinated chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Stir in crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes. Pour in coconut milk and cook for another 10 minutes until sauce thickens. Stir in butter and season with salt to taste. Simmer for 5 more minutes until chicken is tender and sauce is creamy. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.
ingredients: yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, coriander, turmeric, paprika, berbere, chicken, oil, onions, crushed tomatoes, coconut milk, butter, salt, cilantro, rice, flatbread

title: African-asian spiced buttercream cupcakes
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. Cream softened butter and granulated sugar until light and fluffy.
