Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in the milk gradually until fully combined. In a separate bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, cardamom, ginger, and salt. Gradually add dry ingredients to wet mixture and mix until smooth. Divide batter evenly among cupcake liners and bake for 18 to 20 minutes. Let cupcakes cool completely on a wire rack before frosting. For the buttercream, beat butter until creamy, then add powdered sugar gradually. Mix in coconut milk, vanilla, and nutmeg until smooth and fluffy, then frost cooled cupcakes.
ingredients: butter, granulated sugar, eggs, milk, flour, baking powder, cardamom, ginger, salt, powdered sugar, coconut milk, vanilla, nutmeg

title: Butterplaetzchen with cardamom and sesame twist
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. Cream butter and sugar in a bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg, vanilla extract, and milk until well combined. In a separate bowl, mix flour, salt, cardamom, and sesame seeds. Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet mixture and mix into a soft dough. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill for 30 minutes. Roll out dough on a floured surface to 5 mm (1/4 in) thickness. Cut into desired shapes and place on prepared tray. Sprinkle with extra sesame seeds and gently press them in. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes until edges are lightly golden, then cool on a rack.
ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, milk, flour, salt, cardamom, sesame seeds, extra sesame seeds

title: Caipirinha-inspired ginger lemongrass mocktail
directions: Muddle the lime quarters with brown sugar in a pitcher to release juice. Add grated ginger and chopped lemongrass to the mixture. Lightly crush the lemongrass with a wooden spoon to release flavor. Pour in the coconut water and stir well to combine. Let the mixture sit for 10 minutes to infuse flavors. Strain the mixture into a clean pitcher to remove solids. Add ice cubes and top with sparkling water. Stir gently to mix and chill evenly. Pour into glasses and garnish with fresh mint leaves. Serve immediately for a refreshing twist on caipirinha.
ingredients: lime, brown sugar, ginger, lemongrass, coconut water, ice cubes, sparkling water, mint leaves

title: African-asian fusion cevapcici skewers
directions: Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes to prevent burning. In a large bowl, combine ground beef, ground lamb, and all spices. Add minced garlic, grated ginger, chopped chili, and soy sauce. Mix in chopped coriander and egg until well combined. Shape the mixture into small sausage-like logs around each skewer. Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Brush skewers with sesame oil before grilling. Grill skewers for 10 to 12 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through. Serve with spicy peanut sauce and a side of couscous or jasmine rice. Garnish with fresh herbs and lime wedges before serving.
ingredients: wooden skewers, ground beef, ground lamb, spices, garlic, ginger, chili, soy sauce, coriander, egg, sesame oil, spicy peanut sauce, couscous, jasmine rice, fresh herbs, lime wedges

title: Spiced couscous with coconut peanut sauce
directions: Place couscous in a heatproof bowl and pour over boiling water. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until soft and fragrant. Add red bell pepper and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, cumin, and chili flakes. Simmer until sauce thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Combine couscous with the sauce and mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: couscous, boiling water, olive oil, onion, garlic, ginger, red bell pepper, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, cumin, chili flakes, spinach, fresh coriander

title: Simple african-asian peanut coconut chicken
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and Grill until soft and translucent. Stir in garlic, ginger, and chili, cooking for 1 minute. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Stir in peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, and ground coriander. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Stir in lime juice and adjust seasoning if needed. Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, chicken, peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, ground coriander, lime juice, cilantro, rice

title: Grilled tofu with spicy peanut jollof rice
directions: Marinate tofu in soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic for 15 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion and bell pepper until softened. Add rice and stir for 2 minutes to coat with oil and vegetables. Stir in chopped tomatoes, peanut butter, chili flakes, and broth. Season with salt and pepper, then bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes until rice is cooked. Grill marinated tofu on a hot pan until golden on all sides. Fluff rice with a fork and serve topped with grilled tofu. Garnish with chopped herbs or crushed peanuts if desired.
ingredients: tofu, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, garlic, vegetable oil, onion, bell pepper, rice, tomatoes, peanut butter, chili flakes, broth, salt, pepper, herbs, peanuts

title: Spicy african-asian meatloaf sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Grill chopped onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic, ginger, and red chili, then cook for 1 minute. Stir in tomato paste and cook for another minute. Pour in crushed tomatoes and mix well. Add soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, and ground coriander. Simmer uncovered for 10 to 15 minutes until thickened. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving over meatloaf.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, red chili, tomato paste, crushed tomatoes, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, ground coriander, salt, cilantro

title: African-asian spiced yeast plait bread
directions: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water and let sit until frothy. Add flour, salt, warm milk, egg, and melted butter to the yeast mixture and mix to form a dough. Knead the dough on a floured surface for 8 to 10 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover the dough and let it rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Mix ground cumin, coriander, and chili flakes into the dough for an African-Asian flavor twist. Divide the dough into three equal parts and roll each into a rope. Braid the ropes into a plait and tuck the ends underneath. Place the plait on a lined baking sheet, cover, and let rise for another 30 minutes. Brush the plait with beaten egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C (350°F) for 25 to 30 minutes until golden brown.
ingredients: yeast, sugar, warm water, flour, salt, warm milk, egg, melted butter, ground cumin, coriander, chili flakes, sesame seeds

title: Here today african-asian chicken stir-fry
directions: Marinate chicken in soy sauce and suya spice for 15 minutes. Heat groundnut oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same wok, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and cook until slightly tender. Return chicken to the wok and mix well. Stir in cooked rice and drizzle with sesame oil. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring to combine and heat through. Finish with lime juice and garnish with spring onions before serving.
ingredients: chicken, soy sauce, suya spice, groundnut oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, cooked rice, sesame oil, lime juice, spring onions

title: African-asian chicken fricassee fusion
directions: Season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and curry powder. Heat oil in a large pan and brown the chicken on both sides. Remove chicken and Grill onions, garlic, and ginger until softened. Stir in tomato paste, harissa, and soy sauce and cook briefly. Add coconut milk, chicken stock, and lemongrass, then bring to a simmer. Return chicken to the pan and cover, simmering for 25 minutes. Add chopped carrots and bell peppers and cook until tender. Stir in lime juice and chopped coriander before serving. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice or couscous.
ingredients: chicken thighs, salt, pepper, curry powder, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, tomato paste, harissa, soy sauce, coconut milk, chicken stock, lemongrass, carrots, bell peppers, lime juice, coriander, jasmine rice, couscous

title: Spiced african-asian potato pancakes
directions: Place grated potatoes in a clean towel and squeeze out excess moisture. Transfer potatoes to a bowl and mix in onion, garlic, chili, and ginger. Add cumin, curry powder, coriander, salt, and pepper to the mixture. Stir in the beaten egg and flour until well combined. Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Spoon about 2 tablespoons of mixture per pancake into the skillet and flatten slightly. Cook each side for 3 to 4 minutes until golden and crisp. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. Repeat with remaining mixture, adding more oil as needed. Serve warm with a dipping sauce or yogurt.
ingredients: potatoes, onion, garlic, chili, ginger, cumin, curry powder, coriander, salt, pepper, egg, flour, oil

title: Spiced chickpea coconut curry stir-fry
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic and ginger, cook until fragrant. Stir in curry powder and cumin, cook for 1 minute. Add chickpeas and bell pepper, stir to coat with spices. Pour in coconut milk and soy sauce, bring to a simmer. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Add lemon juice and season with salt to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, curry powder, cumin, chickpeas, bell pepper, coconut milk, soy sauce, spinach, lemon juice, salt, fresh cilantro

title: Spiced gingerbread with african-asian flavors
directions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and grease a 20 cm (8-inch) square baking pan. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, and alligator pepper. In a separate bowl, beat eggs, brown sugar, and vanilla until smooth. Stir in molasses, melted butter, coconut milk, and grated galangal to the egg mixture. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Slice and serve plain or with a dollop of whipped coconut cream.
ingredients: flour, baking soda, salt, ginger, cinnamon, cloves, alligator pepper, eggs, brown sugar, vanilla, molasses, melted butter, coconut milk, galangal, whipped coconut cream

title: Delicious african-asian chicken peanut stir-fry
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same skillet, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and green beans, stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, chili flakes, and water. Return chicken to the skillet and pour in the sauce. Stir well and simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Serve hot over jasmine rice. Garnish with chopped roasted peanuts before serving.
ingredients: oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, green beans, soy sauce, peanut butter, honey, chili flakes, water, jasmine rice, roasted peanuts

title: Stir-fried mangold with peanut coconut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add onion and Grill until soft and translucent. Stir in garlic, ginger, and chili and cook for 1 minute. Add chopped mangold and cook until wilted, about 4 minutes. In a bowl, whisk together coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, and coriander. Pour sauce into the pan and stir to coat the mangold evenly. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Add lemon juice and salt to taste. Serve hot over steamed jasmine rice.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, mangold, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, coriander, lemon juice, salt, jasmine rice

title: Spiced naan with african peanut curry
directions: In a bowl, mix flour, sugar, yeast, and salt. Add yogurt and warm water to form a soft dough. Knead for 5 minutes until smooth, then cover and let rise for 1 hour. Heat oil in a pan and Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Stir in cumin, chili flakes, chickpeas, peanut butter, and coconut milk. Simmer for 15 minutes until thickened, then season with salt. Divide dough into 4 pieces and roll into oval shapes. Cook each naan on a hot dry skillet for 1 to 2 minutes per side until puffed and golden. Brush naan with melted butter and sprinkle with cilantro. Serve warm naan with the peanut curry.
ingredients: flour, sugar, yeast, salt, yogurt, warm water, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin, chili flakes, chickpeas, peanut butter, coconut milk, butter, cilantro

title: African-asian mango peanut ice cream
directions: Peel and dice the ripe mangoes into small chunks. In a blender, combine mango, coconut milk, peanut butter, honey, and ginger. Blend until completely smooth and creamy. Pour the mixture into a Ninja Creami pint container and seal tightly. Freeze the container upright for at least 24 hours. Remove from freezer and process in the Ninja Creami using the 'Ice Cream' function. If needed, respin once for smoother texture. Scoop into bowls and top with chopped roasted peanuts and toasted coconut flakes. Serve immediately or store in the freezer for later enjoyment.
ingredients: mango, coconut milk, peanut butter, honey, ginger, roasted peanuts, toasted coconut flakes

title: Spicy african-asian fusion pasta salad
directions: Cook the pasta in salted boiling water until al dente, then drain and rinse under cold water. In a large bowl, whisk together sesame oil, peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic, and chili paste until smooth. Add the cooked pasta to the dressing and toss to coat evenly. Stir in the chickpeas, red bell pepper, cucumber, and spring onions. Mix well to combine all ingredients thoroughly. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and toasted sesame seeds. Chill the salad in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. Toss again before serving to redistribute the dressing.
ingredients: pasta, sesame oil, peanut butter, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic, chili paste, chickpeas, red bell pepper, cucumber, spring onions, cilantro, toasted sesame seeds

title: Coconut chai panna cotta with mango sauce
directions: Sprinkle gelatin over cold water in a small bowl and let bloom for 5 minutes. In a saucepan, combine coconut milk, cream, and sugar over medium heat. Add chai tea bags and simmer gently for 5 minutes, then remove tea bags. Stir in bloomed gelatin until fully dissolved, then remove from heat. Pour mixture into serving glasses and refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Blend mango, lime juice, honey, and cardamom until smooth. Chill mango sauce until ready to serve. Top each panna cotta with mango sauce before serving.
ingredients: gelatin, cold water, coconut milk, cream, sugar, chai tea bags, mango, lime juice, honey, cardamom

title: African-asian fusion peanut pesto noodles
directions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions and drain. In a blender, combine basil, peanuts, garlic, chili, ginger, lime juice, peanut oil, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Blend until smooth to make the pesto, adding a little water if needed for consistency. Toss the cooked noodles with the peanut pesto in a large bowl. Add the carrot, bell pepper, and spring onions to the noodles. Mix well until vegetables and noodles are evenly coated with pesto. Season with salt to taste and toss again. Serve immediately or chill for 15 minutes for a cold noodle salad.
ingredients: rice noodles, basil, peanuts, garlic, chili, ginger, lime juice, peanut oil, soy sauce, sesame oil, carrot, bell pepper, spring onions, salt

title: Spiced quinoa with african-asian vegetables
directions: Combine quinoa and water in a pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes until water is absorbed. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add cumin and curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Stir in eggplant, bell pepper, and green beans. Cook vegetables for 8 to 10 minutes until tender. Add cooked quinoa and soy sauce to the pan and mix well. Cook for another 2 minutes to combine flavors. Garnish with cilantro and lime juice before serving.
ingredients: quinoa, water, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, cumin, curry powder, eggplant, bell pepper, green beans, soy sauce, cilantro, lime juice

title: African-asian fusion ratatouille
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, Grill until fragrant and soft. Stir in eggplant and cook for 5 minutes until starting to soften. Add zucchini and bell peppers, cook for another 5 minutes. Mix in harissa paste, soy sauce, and ground ginger. Pour in diced tomatoes and stir to combine. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving. Serve hot with rice or flatbread.
ingredients: vegetable oil, onion, garlic, eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, harissa paste, soy sauce, ground ginger, diced tomatoes, salt, pepper, fresh cilantro, rice, flatbread

title: Spicy african-asian stir fry for weight loss
directions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger, Grill until fragrant. Add chicken slices and cook until no longer pink. Stir in cumin, turmeric, and chili paste. Add bell pepper, zucchini, and cabbage. Cook vegetables until just tender, stirring frequently. Drizzle soy sauce and lemon juice over the stir fry. Toss to combine and heat through. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot as a light, filling meal.
ingredients: olive oil, garlic, ginger, chicken, cumin, turmeric, chili paste, bell pepper, zucchini, cabbage, soy sauce, lemon juice, fresh coriander

title: African asian spiced beef brisket
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Sear beef brisket on all sides until browned, then remove and set aside. In the same pot, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Stir in coriander, paprika, and tomato paste, cooking for 2 minutes. Return brisket to the pot and add soy sauce, fish sauce, and coconut milk. Add sliced chili and season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer on low heat for 2.5 to 3 hours or until brisket is tender. Remove brisket, slice against the grain, and return to sauce. Simmer uncovered for 10 more minutes to thicken the sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: oil, beef brisket, onion, garlic, ginger, coriander, paprika, tomato paste, soy sauce, fish sauce, coconut milk, chili, salt, pepper, cilantro

title: Spiced beetroot coconut curry
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onions until soft and translucent. Add garlic, ginger, curry powder, cumin, and chili flakes. Stir for 1 minute until fragrant. Add grated beetroot and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour in coconut milk and add salt. Simmer uncovered for 10 minutes until beetroot is tender. Stir in lemon juice and adjust seasoning if needed. Serve hot over cooked jasmine rice. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: oil, onions, garlic, ginger, curry powder, cumin, chili flakes, beetroot, coconut milk, salt, lemon juice, jasmine rice, fresh coriander

title: African-asian fusion coconut sponge cake
directions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F) and grease a 20 cm (8-inch) round cake pan. Sift flour, baking powder, salt, and cardamom into a bowl. In a separate bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Gently fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture. Add coconut milk, vanilla extract, lemon zest, and vegetable oil, stirring until combined. Fold in desiccated coconut evenly. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Serve plain or with a dusting of powdered sugar.
ingredients: flour, baking powder, salt, cardamom, eggs, sugar, coconut milk, vanilla extract, lemon zest, vegetable oil, desiccated coconut, powdered sugar

title: African-asian salt dough chicken parcels
directions: In a bowl, marinate diced chicken with soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and curry powder for 30 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a pan and Grill onion and green chili until soft. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Drizzle with sesame oil, stir, and set aside to cool. In a separate bowl, mix flour and salt, then gradually add water to form a stiff dough. Divide dough into four portions and roll each into a flat circle. Spoon cooked chicken mixture onto each dough circle and fold to seal completely. Place parcels on a baking tray lined with parchment paper. Bake at 200°C (400°F) for 30 minutes until dough is firm and lightly golden. Let cool slightly, crack open salt dough, and serve garnished with coriander.
ingredients: chicken, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, curry powder, vegetable oil, onion, green chili, sesame oil, flour, salt, water, coriander

title: Sourdough chapati with spiced peanut sauce
directions: Mix sourdough starter, flour, warm water, olive oil, and salt in a bowl. Knead the dough until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes. Cover and let rest for 2 hours at room temperature. Divide dough into 8 equal pieces and roll into thin circles. Heat a dry skillet over medium heat and cook each chapati until golden on both sides. Blend peanuts, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, lemon juice, honey, chili flakes, and warm water until smooth. Adjust sauce consistency with more water if needed. Serve warm sourdough chapatis with the spiced peanut sauce.
ingredients: sourdough starter, flour, warm water, olive oil, salt, peanuts, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, lemon juice, honey, chili flakes

title: Quick african-asian peanut noodle stir-fry
directions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions and drain. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and cabbage, stir-fry for 3 minutes. Stir in shredded chicken and cook for 2 more minutes. In a small bowl, whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, and chili flakes. Add sauce and cooked noodles to the pan and toss to combine. Cook for 2 minutes until everything is heated through. Garnish with chopped peanuts and spring onions before serving.
ingredients: rice noodles, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, cabbage, shredded chicken, peanut butter, soy sauce, lime juice, chili flakes, peanuts, spring onions

title: Spiced chocolate cake with ginger and cardamom
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a 20 cm (8 inch) round cake pan. In a large bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, spices, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, whisk eggs, sugar, milk, oil, and vanilla until smooth. Gradually add the wet mixture into the dry ingredients, stirring until combined. Slowly mix in the hot water to form a smooth batter. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and tap to release air bubbles. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar or serve with whipped cream if desired.
ingredients: flour, cocoa powder, spices, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, sugar, milk, oil, vanilla, hot water, powdered sugar, whipped cream

title: African-asian fusion summer rolls
directions: Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable, then lay flat on a damp surface. Place a small amount of chicken, mango, cucumber, carrot, bell pepper, and noodles in the center. Add a few mint and cilantro leaves on top of the filling. Fold the bottom of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in sides and roll tightly. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling ingredients. In a small bowl, mix groundnut sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, ginger, and chili to make dipping sauce. Arrange summer rolls on a serving plate. Serve chilled with dipping sauce on the side.
ingredients: rice paper wrappers, chicken, mango, cucumber, carrot, bell pepper, noodles, mint, cilantro, groundnut sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, ginger, chili

title: African-asian spaghetti carbonara fusion
directions: Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente, then drain and reserve 100 of pasta water. In a bowl, whisk eggs with coconut milk, Parmesan cheese, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Heat groundnut oil in a pan over medium heat and Grill garlic and chili until fragrant. Add suya slices and cook for 2 to 3 minutes until lightly crisp. Reduce heat to low and add cooked spaghetti to the pan. Quickly pour in the egg mixture, tossing constantly to create a creamy sauce without scrambling the eggs. Add reserved pasta water gradually to loosen the sauce if needed. Stir in spring onions and adjust seasoning to taste. Serve immediately while hot with extra Parmesan if desired.
ingredients: spaghetti, salt, coconut milk, Parmesan cheese, soy sauce, pepper, groundnut oil, garlic, chili, suya slices, spring onions

title: African asian spinach stir-fry delight
directions: Heat groundnut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and Grill until fragrant. Stir in the tofu cubes and cook until lightly browned on all sides. Add the chopped spinach and cook until wilted. Pour in soy sauce and coconut milk, stirring to combine. Add ground coriander, chili, and sesame oil, and mix well. Simmer for 5 minutes to allow flavors to blend. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: groundnut oil, onion, garlic, ginger, tofu, spinach, soy sauce, coconut milk, ground coriander, chili, sesame oil, salt, cilantro, rice, flatbread

title: African-asian spiced spritzgebÃ¤ck cookies
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. In a bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg and vanilla extract until well combined. Sift in flour, ground ginger, cardamom, and salt, then mix to form a soft dough. Stir in finely chopped roasted peanuts and black sesame seeds. Transfer dough to a spritz cookie press fitted with a star or flower-shaped disk. Press cookies onto the prepared baking tray, spacing them evenly. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly golden. Cool on the tray for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
ingredients: butter, sugar, egg, vanilla extract, flour, ground ginger, cardamom, salt, roasted peanuts, black sesame seeds

title: Spicy african-asian fusion chicken soup
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger and Grill until fragrant. Stir in chili, coriander, and curry powder and cook for 1 minute. Add diced chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add sweet potatoes and simmer for 15 minutes until tender. Stir in coconut milk and fish sauce and simmer for 5 more minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice. Serve hot with optional chili garnish.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, coriander, curry powder, chicken, chicken broth, sweet potatoes, coconut milk, fish sauce, spinach, lime juice

title: African-asian chicken curry tortilla wraps
directions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add chicken and cook until lightly browned. Stir in curry powder and cumin, cook for 1 minute. Pour in coconut milk and soy sauce, simmer until chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Warm tortillas in a dry pan or microwave. Fill each tortilla with chicken curry, cabbage, and carrot. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Fold and serve warm.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chicken, curry powder, cumin, coconut milk, soy sauce, salt, pepper, tortillas, cabbage, carrot, fresh coriander leaves

title: Cinnamon stars with spiced coconut glaze
directions: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. In a bowl, mix ground almonds, cassava flour, coconut sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and salt. In a separate bowl, beat egg whites until soft peaks form. Fold egg whites gently into the dry mixture to form a soft dough. Roll out dough between two sheets of parchment to about 1 cm (0.4 in) thickness. Cut star shapes using a cookie cutter and place on the prepared tray. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly golden at the edges. In a small saucepan, heat coconut milk, honey, and vanilla over low heat until slightly thickened. Drizzle warm glaze over cooled cookies and sprinkle with desiccated coconut. Let set before serving or storing in an airtight container.
ingredients: ground almonds, cassava flour, coconut sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, salt, egg whites, coconut milk, honey, vanilla, desiccated coconut

title: African-asian spiced apple strudel
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. Toss sliced apples with dried mango, peanuts, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, and honey. Lay one sheet of phyllo on a clean surface and brush lightly with melted butter and oil. Layer remaining phyllo sheets, brushing each with butter and oil. Spoon apple mixture along one edge of the layered phyllo, leaving a border. Fold in the sides and roll up tightly to enclose the filling. Place strudel seam-side down on the baking tray and brush with remaining butter. Sprinkle sesame seeds over the top. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until golden and crisp. Cool slightly before slicing and serving warm.
ingredients: apples, dried mango, peanuts, ginger, cinnamon, cardamom, honey, phyllo, butter, oil, sesame seeds

title: Spiced apple crumble with ginger and coconut
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). Toss apple slices with lemon juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, and ginger. Spread apple mixture evenly in a greased baking dish. In a bowl, combine oats, flour, coconut, and salt. Add butter to dry ingredients and rub together until crumbly. Drizzle honey over the apples in the dish. Sprinkle crumble mixture evenly over the apples. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes until golden and bubbling. Let cool slightly before serving. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or yogurt if desired.
ingredients: apple, lemon juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, oats, flour, coconut, salt, butter, honey, vanilla ice cream, yogurt

title: Farmer's pot with african-asian fusion flavors
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and Grill until fragrant. Stir in chicken and cook until lightly browned. Add bell pepper, sweet potatoes, and green beans. Pour in coconut milk and stir to combine. Mix in peanut butter, soy sauce, cumin, and chili flakes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes until vegetables are tender. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chicken, bell pepper, sweet potatoes, green beans, coconut milk, peanut butter, soy sauce, cumin, chili flakes, salt, pepper

title: African-asian spiced belgian waffles
directions: Preheat the waffle iron according to manufacturer’s instructions. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cardamom, and ginger. In a separate bowl, beat eggs, then mix in milk, melted butter, vanilla, plantain, and sesame oil. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Lightly grease the waffle iron with cooking spray or oil. Pour enough batter into the waffle iron to cover the grid without overflowing. Close the lid and cook until waffles are golden brown and crisp. Carefully remove waffles and keep warm while cooking remaining batter. Serve hot with honey, fresh fruit, or spiced yogurt.
ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cardamom, ginger, eggs, milk, melted butter, vanilla, plantain, sesame oil, cooking spray, honey, fresh fruit, spiced yogurt

title: Spicy fried potatoes with african-asian flair
directions: Boil diced potatoes in salted water for 8 minutes until slightly tender. Drain and let the potatoes cool completely. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant. Add curry powder, paprika, and turmeric, stirring for 1 minute. Add potatoes and stir to coat with the spices. Fry potatoes until golden and crisp, about 10 minutes. Drizzle soy sauce over the potatoes and toss well. Cook for another 2 minutes to blend flavors. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: potatoes, salt, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, curry powder, paprika, turmeric, soy sauce, fresh coriander

title: Spicy african-asian stir-fry with hemp oil
directions: Heat hemp seed oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, add onion, garlic, and ginger and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add bell pepper and cook until slightly tender. Return chicken to the pan and stir in soy sauce and chili paste. Drizzle with sesame oil and lime juice, then toss to coat evenly. Serve hot over cooked jasmine rice. Garnish with chopped cilantro and toasted sesame seeds.
ingredients: hemp seed oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, soy sauce, chili paste, sesame oil, lime juice, jasmine rice, cilantro, toasted sesame seeds

title: Spiced hibiscus ginger cocktail fusion
directions: Brew hibiscus petals in boiling water for 10 minutes, then strain and cool. Peel and grate fresh ginger, then press to extract juice. In a shaker, combine chilled hibiscus tea, ginger juice, lime juice, honey, and vodka. Add crushed ice and shake vigorously for 20 seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glasses. Top with a splash of sparkling water for fizz. Garnish with lime slices and a few mint leaves. Serve immediately while cold.
ingredients: hibiscus petals, ginger, lime juice, honey, vodka, crushed ice, sparkling water, lime slices, mint leaves

title: African-asian fusion coleslaw recipe
directions: Combine green cabbage, red cabbage, carrot, and red onion in a large bowl. Add green chili, cilantro, and crushed peanuts to the vegetables. In a separate small bowl, whisk rice vinegar, lime juice, sesame oil, and mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in ground ginger, salt, and pepper to the dressing. Pour the dressing over the cabbage mixture. Toss everything together until evenly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Garnish with extra peanuts and cilantro if desired. Serve chilled as a side dish or salad.
ingredients: green cabbage, red cabbage, carrot, red onion, green chili, cilantro, crushed peanuts, rice vinegar, lime juice, sesame oil, mayonnaise, ground ginger, salt, pepper

title: Danube wave fusion chicken stir-fry
directions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce and a pinch of pepper for 10 minutes. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion, garlic, and ginger, and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Stir in bell pepper and chili, and cook for another 3 minutes. Add jollof rice and mix well to combine with the chicken and vegetables. Pour in coconut milk and sprinkle curry powder over the mixture. Stir-fry for 2 more minutes until everything is heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: chicken, soy sauce, pepper, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, chili, jollof rice, coconut milk, curry powder, salt, fresh coriander

title: Spicy african-asian egg salad
directions: Place eggs in a pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Simmer eggs for 10 minutes, then cool in ice water and peel. Chop the eggs into bite-sized pieces and place in a mixing bowl. Add chopped red onion, chili pepper, cilantro, and scallions. In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise, yogurt, rice vinegar, mustard, soy sauce, and berbere spice. Pour the dressing over the egg mixture and toss gently to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Chill the salad for 15 to 20 minutes to let flavors meld. Serve on lettuce leaves or with flatbread.
ingredients: eggs, water, red onion, chili pepper, cilantro, scallions, mayonnaise, yogurt, rice vinegar, mustard, soy sauce, berbere spice, salt, pepper, lettuce leaves, flatbread

title: African-asian fusion fanta cake recipe
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a 20 cm (8-inch) round cake pan. In a bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light and fluffy. Add oil, vanilla extract, ginger, lime zest, and coconut milk to the egg mixture and mix well. Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until just combined. Gently fold in the Fanta soda until the batter is smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar or top with a citrus glaze before serving if desired.
ingredients: flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, sugar, oil, vanilla extract, ginger, lime zest, coconut milk, Fanta soda, powdered sugar

title: Spicy chicken samosa bites with peanut dip
directions: Heat a little oil in a pan and Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until soft. Add shredded chicken, curry powder, soy sauce, and mashed sweet potato. Cook for 2 minutes, then stir in chopped cilantro and let cool. Cut wrappers into halves and fill each with a spoonful of the chicken mixture. Fold into triangles and seal edges with a dab of water. Heat oil in a deep pan and fry samosas until golden brown and crispy. Remove and drain on paper towels. Whisk together peanut butter, lime juice, honey, and warm water until smooth. Serve samosa bites warm with the peanut dipping sauce.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, shredded chicken, curry powder, soy sauce, mashed sweet potato, cilantro, wrappers, water, peanut butter, lime juice, honey, warm water

title: Spiced rooibos ginger gluehwein fusion
directions: Combine red wine and brewed rooibos tea in a large saucepan. Add ginger, cinnamon stick, cloves, star anise, orange slices, lemongrass, and cardamom. Heat mixture over low heat without boiling for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to blend flavors evenly. Remove from heat and let steep for 10 minutes. Strain the mixture to remove solids. Stir in honey until dissolved. Serve warm in heatproof mugs.
ingredients: red wine, brewed rooibos tea, ginger, cinnamon stick, cloves, star anise, orange slices, lemongrass, cardamom, honey

title: Minced meat stir-fry with jollof rice
directions: Rinse jasmine rice and set aside. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pan and Grill chopped onions until soft. Add garlic and ginger, stir for 1 minute until fragrant. Add minced beef and cook until browned, breaking up lumps. Stir in tomato paste, soy sauce, curry powder, and chili flakes. Add bell pepper and cook for 3 minutes until slightly tender. In a separate pot, heat remaining oil and toast rice for 2 minutes. Pour in chicken broth and salt, bring to a boil, then simmer covered for 15 minutes. Fluff rice and serve topped with the minced meat stir-fry. Garnish with chopped green onions before serving.
ingredients: jasmine rice, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, minced beef, tomato paste, soy sauce, curry powder, chili flakes, bell pepper, chicken broth, salt, green onions

title: Hello fresh african-asian chicken stir-fry
directions: Heat peanut oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. Add onion, bell peppers, garlic, and ginger to the pan. Stir-fry vegetables until tender-crisp, about 4 to 5 minutes. Return chicken to the pan and stir to combine. Add soy sauce, suya spice, and honey to the pan. Toss everything well and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve over cooked jasmine rice. Garnish with cilantro, sesame seeds, and lime wedges.
ingredients: peanut oil, chicken, onion, bell peppers, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, suya spice, honey, jasmine rice, cilantro, sesame seeds, lime wedges

title: Spiced chai coffee chicken stir-fry
directions: Brew strong black coffee and set aside to cool slightly. In a bowl, mix brewed coffee, soy sauce, honey, and chai spices to make a marinade. Add sliced chicken to the marinade and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Add bell peppers and onions, stir-fry until tender-crisp. Stir in a splash of marinade and simmer for 2 minutes. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredients: black coffee, soy sauce, honey, chai spices, chicken, oil, bell peppers, onions, cilantro, rice

title: Spicy african-asian stir-fried potatoes
directions: Boil diced potatoes in salted water until just tender, then drain. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add onions and Grill until soft and lightly golden. Stir in garlic, ginger, green chilies, cumin, curry powder, and chili flakes. Cook spices for 1 minute until fragrant. Add boiled potatoes and stir-fry for 5 to 7 minutes until edges are crispy. Drizzle with soy sauce and lime juice, tossing to coat evenly. Season with salt to taste and cook for 2 more minutes. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped coriander. Serve hot as a side or light main dish.
ingredients: potatoes, salt, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, green chilies, cumin, curry powder, chili flakes, soy sauce, lime juice, coriander

title: African-asian koenigsberger klopse fusion
directions: Combine ground beef, lamb, onion, garlic, egg, breadcrumbs, soy sauce, and spices in a large bowl. Mix well and form into small meatballs about the size of a golf ball. Bring beef broth to a simmer in a large pan over medium heat. Gently place meatballs into the broth and simmer for 15 minutes until cooked through. Remove meatballs and set aside, reserving the broth. Add coconut milk, capers, and rice vinegar to the broth and bring to a gentle boil. Stir in the cornflour slurry and cook until the sauce thickens slightly. Return meatballs to the sauce and simmer for 5 more minutes. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: ground beef, lamb, onion, garlic, egg, breadcrumbs, soy sauce, spices, beef broth, coconut milk, capers, rice vinegar, cornflour, meatballs, steamed rice, flatbread

title: Spicy jollof fried rice fusion
directions: Cook jasmine rice according to package instructions and set aside to cool. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat and Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add diced chicken and cook until no longer pink, then add shrimp and cook until opaque. Stir in tomato paste, canned tomatoes, curry powder, and chili flakes. Simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Add cooked rice to the pan and mix well to coat with the sauce. Drizzle in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes until everything is heated through. Garnish with sliced spring onions before serving. Serve hot as a main dish.
ingredients: jasmine rice, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chicken, shrimp, tomato paste, canned tomatoes, curry powder, chili flakes, soy sauce, salt, pepper, spring onions

title: African-asian fusion langos with spicy peanut sauce
directions: Combine warm milk, sugar, and yeast in a bowl and let sit for 10 minutes. Add flour, salt, yogurt, and 1 tablespoon oil to the yeast mixture and mix to form a dough. Knead dough on a floured surface for 5 minutes until smooth. Cover and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour or until doubled in size. Meanwhile, whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar, chili paste, water, and minced garlic in a saucepan over low heat until smooth and warm. Divide dough into 4 portions and flatten each into an oval shape. Heat oil in a deep pan over medium heat and fry each langos until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels and serve warm. Drizzle with spicy peanut sauce and garnish with fresh coriander.
ingredients: milk, sugar, yeast, flour, salt, yogurt, oil, peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar, chili paste, water, garlic, coriander

title: Lillet-infused chicken with ginger peanut sauce
directions: Combine Lillet Blanc, soy sauce, ginger, and garlic in a bowl. Add chicken pieces and marinate for at least 30 minutes. Heat peanut oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. In a small saucepan, combine chili, lime juice, peanut butter, coconut milk, and honey. Simmer sauce over low heat until smooth and slightly thickened. Pour sauce over cooked chicken and stir to coat evenly. Simmer together for 2 to 3 minutes to blend flavors. Serve hot over jasmine rice and garnish with coriander leaves.
ingredients: Lillet Blanc, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chicken, peanut oil, chili, lime juice, peanut butter, coconut milk, honey, jasmine rice, coriander leaves

title: African-asian spiced muerbe dough hand pies
directions: Combine flour and salt in a bowl and cut in the cold butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk and cold water, mixing until dough forms. Wrap dough in plastic and chill for 30 minutes. Grill onion and garlic in a pan until softened. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Stir in cumin, coriander, soy sauce, and chili paste, then cook for 3 minutes. Remove from heat and mix in chopped cilantro. Roll out dough and cut into 10 cm (4 inch) circles. Place a spoonful of filling on each circle and fold into a half-moon shape. Seal edges with a fork, brush with egg wash, and bake at 180°C (350°F) for 25 minutes.
ingredients: flour, salt, cold butter, egg yolk, cold water, onion, garlic, ground beef, cumin, coriander, soy sauce, chili paste, cilantro, egg wash

title: African-asian fusion chicken paella
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add chicken pieces and brown on all sides. Stir in curry powder, turmeric, and chili paste. Add rice and mix to coat with spices. Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender. Add peas and cooked shrimp, then heat through. Garnish with chopped coriander and lemon wedges. Serve hot with extra chili sauce if desired.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chicken, curry powder, turmeric, chili paste, rice, chicken broth, peas, shrimp, coriander, lemon, chili sauce

title: Spicy stir-fried pak choi with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add tofu and cook until golden on all sides, then set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Stir in the chili paste, soy sauce, and fish sauce. Add peanut butter, coconut milk, brown sugar, and lime juice. Simmer sauce for 3 minutes until slightly thickened. Return tofu to the pan and stir to coat. Add pak choi and cook for 3 to 4 minutes until just wilted. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh coriander. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, tofu, onion, garlic, ginger, chili paste, soy sauce, fish sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, brown sugar, lime juice, pak choi, fresh coriander, steamed rice, flatbread

title: Spicy african-asian fusion peanut pasta
directions: Cook pasta in boiling salted water until al dente, then drain and set aside. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant and soft. Add shredded chicken and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, and lime juice until smooth. Simmer sauce for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened. Add cooked pasta to the sauce and toss to coat evenly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with sliced green onions and fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: pasta, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, shredded chicken, peanut butter, coconut milk, soy sauce, lime juice, salt, pepper, green onions, fresh coriander

title: Chanterelle mushroom stir-fry with ugali
directions: Bring water to a boil in a pot and gradually stir in maize flour to make ugali. Cook ugali over low heat, stirring constantly, until thick and smooth, about 10 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion until soft and translucent. Add garlic, ginger, and chili, and cook for 2 minutes until fragrant. Stir in chanterelle mushrooms and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and ground coriander and stir well. Fold in spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt to taste. Serve hot mushroom stir-fry with freshly made ugali.
ingredients: water, maize flour, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, chanterelle mushrooms, soy sauce, oyster sauce, ground coriander, spinach, lemon juice, salt

title: Spicy african-asian fusion pizza
directions: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface and transfer to a baking tray. In a small bowl, mix satay sauce, harissa paste, soy sauce, ginger, and garlic. Spread the sauce mixture evenly over the pizza dough. Top with shredded chicken, red onion slices, and green chili if using. Sprinkle mozzarella and cheddar cheeses evenly over the toppings. Drizzle vegetable oil lightly over the pizza. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until the crust is golden and cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.
ingredients: pizza dough, flour, satay sauce, harissa paste, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, shredded chicken, red onion, green chili, mozzarella cheese, cheddar cheese, vegetable oil, fresh coriander leaves

title: Spiced haunch of venison with peanut curry sauce
directions: Rub venison haunch with cumin, coriander, cinnamon, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear venison on all sides until browned, then remove and set aside. In the same skillet, Grill onion until soft and golden. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in chopped tomatoes and simmer for 5 minutes. Add coconut milk and peanut butter, stirring until smooth. Return venison to skillet, cover, and simmer on low for 45 minutes or until tender. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: venison haunch, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, chili powder, salt, pepper, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, tomatoes, coconut milk, peanut butter, fresh coriander, rice, flatbread

title: African-asian spiced rehrÃ¼cken fusion
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with foil. Rub venison loin with salt, pepper, and ground spices. Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat and sear meat on all sides. Transfer seared venison to the baking tray and roast for 15 to 20 minutes. In a saucepan, Grill onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add soy sauce, tamarind paste, honey, and chili flakes and simmer briefly. Stir in coconut milk and ground peanuts, then cook until sauce thickens. Remove venison from oven and let rest for 5 minutes before slicing. Serve sliced venison over steamed rice with sauce drizzled on top. Garnish with chopped coriander and toasted sesame seeds.
ingredients: venison loin, salt, pepper, ground spices, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, tamarind paste, honey, chili flakes, coconut milk, ground peanuts, steamed rice, coriander, toasted sesame seeds

title: Spicy african-asian peanut chicken stir-fry
directions: Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and green beans, stir-fry until slightly tender. Return chicken to the pan and mix well. Stir in soy sauce, fish sauce, peanut butter, chili flakes, and chicken broth. Simmer for 5 minutes until sauce thickens and coats the chicken. Add lime juice and stir to combine. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, green beans, soy sauce, fish sauce, peanut butter, chili flakes, chicken broth, lime juice, fresh coriander

title: Spicy african-asian chicken rice bowl
directions: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Combine rice and water in a pot, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer covered for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant and soft. Add diced chicken and cook until lightly browned on all sides. Stir in soy sauce, African chili paste, and ground coriander. Cook for another 5 to 7 minutes until chicken is fully cooked and sauce thickens. Add cabbage and carrot, stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes until slightly tender. Fluff the cooked rice and divide into bowls. Top with chicken mixture, garnish with spring onions and cilantro before serving.
ingredients: rice, water, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chicken, soy sauce, African chili paste, ground coriander, cabbage, carrot, spring onions, cilantro

title: African asian fusion beef goulash
directions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and Grill until soft and translucent. Stir in garlic, ginger, and chili and cook for 1 minute. Add beef and brown on all sides. Sprinkle in curry powder and coriander, stir to coat the beef. Pour in soy sauce, tomatoes, and beef broth. Stir in peanut butter and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat, cover, and cook for 1 hour or until beef is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: oil, onions, garlic, ginger, chili, beef, curry powder, coriander, soy sauce, tomatoes, beef broth, peanut butter, salt, pepper, cilantro

title: African-asian spiced beef roulades
directions: Lay beef slices flat and lightly pound if needed to even thickness. In a bowl, mix soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, sesame oil, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Rub marinade over beef slices and let sit for 30 minutes. Place onions, bell peppers, carrots, and cilantro evenly on each beef slice. Roll each slice tightly and secure with toothpicks or kitchen twine. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sear roulades on all sides until browned, about 6 to 8 minutes total. Reduce heat, cover, and cook for another 10 minutes until beef is cooked through. Remove toothpicks or twine before serving. Serve warm with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: beef, soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, sesame oil, coriander, cumin, paprika, salt, pepper, onions, bell peppers, carrots, cilantro, vegetable oil, rice, flatbread

title: Spicy red cabbage stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large wok over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, ginger, and chili and Grill until fragrant. Stir in sliced red cabbage and cook for 5 to 7 minutes until slightly softened. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, peanut butter, and water. Pour the sauce into the wok and stir well to coat the cabbage. Cook for another 3 to 5 minutes until cabbage is tender-crisp and sauce thickens. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped peanuts. Garnish with fresh coriander before serving. Serve hot with steamed rice or flatbread.
ingredients: oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, red cabbage, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, peanut butter, water, peanuts, coriander, rice, flatbread

title: Healthy african-asian quinoa stir fry
directions: Combine quinoa and water in a pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes until water is absorbed. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper, cabbage, and kale and cook until wilted. Stir in cooked quinoa and mix well. Add soy sauce, sesame oil, turmeric, and chili if using. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and squeeze lime juice over the stir fry. Serve warm as a main or side dish.
ingredients: quinoa, water, olive oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, cabbage, kale, soy sauce, sesame oil, turmeric, chili, lime juice

title: African-asian roast pork with spiced glaze
directions: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F). In a bowl, mix soy sauce, harissa paste, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, coriander, cumin, salt, and pepper. Rub the pork shoulder thoroughly with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight for best flavor. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear the pork on all sides until browned, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer pork to a roasting pan and cover with foil. Roast for 1.5 to 2 hours, basting occasionally with juices. Remove foil and roast uncovered for the last 20 minutes to caramelize the glaze. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and garnish with fresh cilantro.
ingredients: soy sauce, harissa paste, honey, rice vinegar, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, coriander, cumin, salt, pepper, pork shoulder, vegetable oil, fresh cilantro

title: Spiced coconut scones with ginger and cardamom
directions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper. In a large bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom, ginger, and salt. Cut in the butter using fingertips until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. In a separate bowl, whisk together coconut milk, egg, and vanilla extract. Pour wet ingredients into dry mixture and stir gently until just combined. Turn dough onto a floured surface and pat into a 2.5 cm (1 inch) thick round. Cut into 8 wedges or rounds and place on prepared baking tray. Brush tops with honey and sprinkle with desiccated coconut. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Cool slightly on a wire rack before serving warm.
ingredients: flour, sugar, baking powder, cardamom, ginger, salt, butter, coconut milk, egg, vanilla extract, honey, desiccated coconut

title: Spicy african-asian shakshuka fusion
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Grill onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add diced bell pepper, chopped tomatoes, and chili paste. Stir in soy sauce, ground cumin, paprika, and turmeric. Simmer mixture for 10 minutes until thickened. Create small wells in the sauce and crack in the eggs. Cover and cook until eggs are set to your liking. Sprinkle with chopped scallions and fresh cilantro. Drizzle with sesame oil before serving. Serve hot with warm flatbread or steamed rice.
ingredients: oil, onions, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, tomatoes, chili paste, soy sauce, ground cumin, paprika, turmeric, eggs, scallions, cilantro, sesame oil, flatbread, rice

title: African-asian coconut chicken with curry sprinkles
directions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic, ginger, curry powder, and salt for 30 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Stir in coconut milk and simmer for 10 minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted. Toast sesame seeds and crushed peanuts in a dry pan until golden. Serve chicken over steamed jasmine rice. Sprinkle toasted seeds, peanuts, and chili flakes over the dish before serving.
ingredients: chicken, yogurt, garlic, ginger, curry powder, salt, oil, coconut milk, spinach, sesame seeds, crushed peanuts, jasmine rice, chili flakes

title: Spiced coconut sweet potato cakes
directions: Boil sweet potatoes until tender, then mash until smooth. In a bowl, combine mashed sweet potatoes, flour, coconut, sugar, spices, and salt. Add egg and coconut milk to form a thick batter. Shape mixture into small patties, about 1 cm (0.4 in) thick. Optional: roll patties in extra coconut for a crispy coating. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Fry patties in batches for 2 to 3 minutes per side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil. Serve warm with yogurt or a tangy dipping sauce.
ingredients: sweet potatoes, flour, coconut, sugar, spices, salt, egg, coconut milk, oil, yogurt

title: White cabbage stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add garlic, ginger, and red onion, and Grill until fragrant. Stir in carrot and cook for 2 minutes until slightly tender. Add white cabbage and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. In a bowl, whisk together peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar, coconut milk, and chili flakes. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir well to coat evenly. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes until the cabbage is tender and sauce thickens. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: oil, garlic, ginger, red onion, carrot, white cabbage, peanut butter, soy sauce, vinegar, coconut milk, chili flakes, salt, fresh coriander

title: African-asian peanut curry noodles
directions: Soak rice noodles in hot water for 10 minutes, then drain. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Stir in ground coriander and soy sauce. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Mix in peanut butter until smooth and combined. Add noodles and toss to coat evenly. Simmer for 3 minutes until heated through. Finish with lemon juice and fresh coriander before serving.
ingredients: rice noodles, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, chicken, ground coriander, soy sauce, coconut milk, peanut butter, lemon juice, fresh coriander

title: Spicy african-asian chicken wraps
directions: Mix soy sauce, peanut butter, harissa paste, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger in a bowl. Add sliced chicken to the marinade and let sit for 20 minutes. Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Cook marinated chicken until browned and cooked through, about 8 minutes. Warm flatbreads in a dry skillet or microwave. Layer cabbage, carrot, onion, and cooked chicken onto each flatbread. Top with fresh coriander leaves. Fold wraps tightly and slice in half if desired. Serve warm with lime wedges on the side.
ingredients: soy sauce, peanut butter, harissa paste, sesame oil, garlic, ginger, chicken, vegetable oil, flatbreads, cabbage, carrot, onion, fresh coriander leaves, lime

title: Savory onion tart with african-asian spices
directions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and Grill onions until soft and golden. Add ginger, coriander, turmeric, and chili flakes to onions and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute, then remove from heat. In a bowl, whisk eggs with coconut milk, salt, and pepper. Place puff pastry in a tart pan and prick the base with a fork. Spread the spiced onion mixture evenly over the pastry. Pour the egg and coconut milk mixture over the onions. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until the filling is set and golden. Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.
ingredients: oil, onions, ginger, coriander, turmeric, chili flakes, soy sauce, eggs, coconut milk, salt, pepper, puff pastry, cilantro

title: American-inspired african asian chicken stir-fry
directions: Marinate chicken with soy sauce, peanut butter, tomato paste, lemon juice, paprika, salt, and pepper for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and stir-fry until slightly tender. Return chicken to the pan and toss to combine with vegetables. Cook for an additional 2 to 3 minutes to blend flavors. Serve hot over jasmine rice. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: chicken, soy sauce, peanut butter, tomato paste, lemon juice, paprika, salt, pepper, oil, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, jasmine rice, cilantro

title: Spicy jollof fried rice fusion
directions: Rinse the rice thoroughly and cook until just tender, then set aside. Heat oil in a large wok and Grill onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add diced bell peppers and carrots, stir-fry for 3 minutes. Mix in tomato paste, curry powder, and chili flakes, cooking for 2 minutes. Add cooked rice and stir well to coat with the sauce. Pour in soy sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Fold in cooked shrimp and allow to heat through for 2 minutes. Garnish with chopped scallions and serve hot.
ingredients: rice, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, bell peppers, carrots, tomato paste, curry powder, chili flakes, soy sauce, salt, pepper, shrimp, scallions

title: Spicy honey chicken on sheet pan flatbread
directions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) and line a sheet pan with parchment paper. In a bowl, mix soy sauce, harissa paste, honey, rice vinegar, ginger, and garlic. Add chicken strips to the marinade and let sit for 15 minutes. Spread marinated chicken, bell pepper, and onion evenly on the sheet pan. Drizzle with sesame oil and bake for 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Warm flatbread on a separate rack for the last 5 minutes of baking. Top flatbread with cooked chicken and vegetables. Sprinkle with cilantro and sesame seeds before serving.
ingredients: soy sauce, harissa paste, honey, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic, chicken strips, bell pepper, onion, sesame oil, flatbread, cilantro, sesame seeds

title: African asian fusion burger patties
directions: In a large bowl, combine ground beef, grated ginger, and minced garlic. Add chopped scallions, soy sauce, berbere spice, and sesame oil to the mixture. Mix thoroughly with hands until all ingredients are evenly combined. Form the mixture into 4 equal-sized patties. Heat a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat and lightly oil the surface. Cook patties for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until fully cooked through. Remove from heat and let rest for 2 minutes before serving. Serve on toasted buns with your choice of toppings like pickled vegetables or spicy mayo.
ingredients: ground beef, grated ginger, minced garlic, chopped scallions, soy sauce, berbere spice, sesame oil, toasted buns, pickled vegetables, spicy mayo

title: African asian fusion burger recipe
directions: In a bowl, mix ground beef with onion, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, harissa, and ground coriander. Form the mixture into 4 equal burger patties. Heat a grill or skillet over medium heat and cook patties for 4 to 5 minutes per side until fully cooked. In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise with sriracha to make a spicy mayo. In another bowl, toss cucumber and carrot with rice vinegar and set aside. Toast the burger buns lightly on the grill or in a pan. Spread spicy mayo on the bottom half of each bun. Place the cooked burger patty on top of the mayo. Top with pickled cucumber and carrot mixture and fresh cilantro leaves. Close the buns and serve immediately.
ingredients: ground beef, onion, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, harissa, ground coriander, mayonnaise, sriracha, cucumber, carrot, rice vinegar, burger buns, cilantro leaves

title: Cannabis-infused jollof fried rice
directions: Rinse the rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Heat cannabis-infused coconut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Grill onions, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant and softened. Add bell pepper, curry powder, paprika, and stir for 2 minutes. Pour in chopped tomatoes and cook until slightly reduced. Stir in rice and mix well to coat with the sauce. Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15 to 18 minutes until rice is cooked. Stir in soy sauce and fluff the rice with a fork. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: rice, cannabis-infused coconut oil, onions, garlic, ginger, chili, bell pepper, curry powder, paprika, chopped tomatoes, vegetable broth, soy sauce, fresh cilantro

title: Chicory stir-fry with peanut sauce
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add tofu cubes and fry until golden on all sides, then remove and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, ginger, and chili until fragrant. Add the sliced chicory and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes until slightly wilted. Return tofu to the pan and mix well with the vegetables. In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, brown sugar, and lime juice. Pour the sauce into the pan and stir to coat all ingredients evenly. Simmer for 2 to 3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice.
ingredients: vegetable oil, tofu, onion, garlic, ginger, chili, chicory, soy sauce, peanut butter, coconut milk, brown sugar, lime juice, fresh coriander leaves, jasmine rice

title: Spicy african-asian coconut curry
directions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add onions and Grill until translucent. Stir in garlic, ginger, and chili and cook for 2 minutes. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Sprinkle in curry powder, cumin, and paprika and stir well. Pour in coconut milk and diced tomatoes and mix thoroughly. Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes until chicken is tender. Uncover and simmer for another 5 minutes to thicken sauce. Garnish with coriander leaves before serving.
ingredients: oil, onions, garlic, ginger, chili, chicken, curry powder, cumin, paprika, coconut milk, diced tomatoes, soy sauce, salt, pepper, coriander leaves

title: Perfect dinner today: african-asian chicken stir-fry
directions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add sliced chicken and cook until browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and green beans and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. Return chicken to the pan and mix well. Stir in soy sauce, groundnut paste, coriander, and chili flakes. Cook for 2 to 3 more minutes until sauce thickens slightly. Serve hot over cooked jasmine rice. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, green beans, soy sauce, groundnut paste, coriander, chili flakes, jasmine rice, cilantro

title: Spiced iced coffee with cardamom and hibiscus
directions: Brew strong coffee and let it cool to room temperature. Prepare hibiscus tea and chill it in the refrigerator. In a large pitcher, combine cooled coffee and hibiscus tea. Add milk, sweetened condensed milk, and vanilla extract. Stir in cardamom, ginger, cinnamon, and brown sugar. Mix well until sugar is completely dissolved. Fill glasses with ice cubes. Pour the spiced coffee mixture over the ice. Stir gently before serving. Garnish with a sprinkle of ground cardamom if desired.
ingredients: coffee, hibiscus tea, milk, sweetened condensed milk, vanilla extract, cardamom, ginger, cinnamon, brown sugar, ice cubes, ground cardamom

title: Spiced african-asian fusion flatbread
directions: In a large bowl, mix flour, salt, cumin, turmeric, and chili flakes. Stir in yogurt, warm water, and oil until a soft dough forms. Add garlic, ginger, cilantro, and sesame seeds to the dough and knead until smooth. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes at room temperature. Divide the dough into 4 equal balls and roll each into a flat round shape. Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat until hot. Cook each flatbread for 2 to 3 minutes per side until golden and cooked through. Brush with a little oil or butter if desired before serving. Serve warm with dips, stews, or grilled meats.
ingredients: flour, salt, cumin, turmeric, chili flakes, yogurt, warm water, oil, garlic, ginger, cilantro, sesame seeds, butter

title: Spicy coconut curry with fufu
directions: Boil cassava and yam in salted water until soft, about 25 minutes. Drain and mash with butter until smooth and stretchy to form fufu. Heat oil in a pan and Grill onions until translucent. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. Stir in red curry paste and cook until fragrant. Add chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Pour in coconut milk and chopped tomatoes. Simmer for 15 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Stir in soy sauce and adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot curry over or alongside warm fufu, garnished with coriander.
ingredients: cassava, yam, butter, oil, onions, garlic, ginger, red curry paste, chicken, coconut milk, tomatoes, soy sauce, coriander

title: Spicy african-asian gazpacho fusion
directions: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, garlic, and chili in a blender. Add rice vinegar, soy sauce, groundnut oil, ginger, cumin, and cold water. Blend until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and black pepper to taste. Chill the gazpacho in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Stir well before serving. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve cold in bowls or glasses.
ingredients: tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, garlic, chili, rice vinegar, soy sauce, groundnut oil, ginger, cumin, cold water, salt, black pepper, fresh coriander leaves

title: Spiced gin and tonic chicken stir-fry
directions: Marinate the chicken with gin, soy sauce, fish sauce, garlic, and ginger for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until browned and nearly cooked through. Add the red onion, chili, and bell pepper to the pan and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. Pour in the tonic water and cook until the liquid reduces slightly and the chicken is fully cooked. Squeeze lime juice over the stir-fry and toss to combine. Remove from heat and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with steamed jasmine rice.
ingredients: chicken, gin, soy sauce, fish sauce, garlic, ginger, oil, red onion, chili, bell pepper, tonic water, lime juice, fresh coriander leaves, jasmine rice

title: Golden milk with african-asian spices
directions: Combine coconut milk and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Add turmeric, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, cloves, and alligator pepper. Stir well and bring to a gentle simmer. Add black pepper, salt, and vanilla extract. Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat and let steep for 2 minutes. Strain through a fine mesh sieve into a teapot or jug. Stir in honey while warm until dissolved. Serve hot or warm in mugs. Garnish with a sprinkle of cinnamon if desired.
ingredients: coconut milk, water, turmeric, cinnamon, cardamom, ginger, cloves, alligator pepper, black pepper, salt, vanilla extract, honey

title: African asian spiced gaensebrust stir-fry
directions: Score the skin of the goose breast and season with salt and pepper. Heat a pan over medium heat and sear the goose breast skin-side down until crispy. Flip and cook the other side for a few minutes, then remove and slice thinly. In a bowl, mix soy sauce, harissa paste, ginger, garlic, coriander, and honey. Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large pan over high heat. Add onion and bell pepper, stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add green beans and continue to stir-fry until just tender. Add sliced goose and sauce mixture to the pan. Stir-fry everything together for 3 to 4 minutes until heated through. Drizzle with sesame oil and garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: goose breast, salt, pepper, soy sauce, harissa paste, ginger, garlic, coriander, honey, vegetable oil, onion, bell pepper, green beans, sesame oil, fresh cilantro

title: Spicy peanut chicken stir-fry with jollof rice
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a pot over medium heat. Add rice and stir to coat, then add canned tomatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes until rice is cooked. Heat remaining oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned and cooked through, then remove and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger for 2 minutes. Add bell peppers and stir-fry for 4 minutes until slightly tender. Return chicken to the pan, add peanut butter, soy sauce, and chili flakes. Stir well until sauce is smooth and everything is coated and heated through. Serve chicken stir-fry over a bed of jollof rice, garnished with chopped peanuts if desired.
ingredients: oil, rice, canned tomatoes, chicken broth, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell peppers, peanut butter, soy sauce, chili flakes, jollof rice, peanuts

title: Elderflower chicken with coconut jollof rice
directions: Marinate chicken with elderflower cordial, soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, and ground coriander for 20 minutes. Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add marinated chicken and cook until browned on all sides. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion and bell pepper until softened. Add rice, stir to coat with oil and vegetables. Pour in coconut milk and chopped tomatoes, then stir in curry powder. Return chicken to the pan, season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer on low heat for 20 minutes or until rice is cooked. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
ingredients: chicken, elderflower cordial, soy sauce, ginger-garlic paste, ground coriander, oil, onion, bell pepper, rice, coconut milk, chopped tomatoes, curry powder, salt, pepper, fresh cilantro

title: Low-calorie african-asian chicken stir-fry
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chicken slices and cook until lightly browned and cooked through. Remove chicken and set aside. In the same pan, Grill onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add bell pepper and cabbage and stir-fry for 3 to 4 minutes. Return chicken to the pan and mix well. Stir in soy sauce, suya spice, rice vinegar, and sesame oil. Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes until everything is well coated and heated through. Sprinkle with chili flakes and chopped spring onions. Serve hot over cooked brown rice.
ingredients: olive oil, chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, bell pepper, cabbage, soy sauce, suya spice, rice vinegar, sesame oil, chili flakes, spring onions, brown rice

title: Spicy african-asian carrot salad
directions: Place julienned carrots and sliced red onion in a large bowl. In a small bowl, whisk together rice vinegar, lime juice, soy sauce, and sesame oil. Add ground cumin, grated ginger, and chopped chili to the dressing and mix well. Pour the dressing over the carrot mixture and toss to combine.
